Company Overview
Founded in 1978 and headquartered in Denver, Colorado, the Grease Monkey® brand currently operates more than 300 centers internationally with operations in Mexico, China, Colombia and Saudi Arabia. Grease Monkey® is the nation’s largest independent franchisor of automotive oil change centers and is looking to expand in 2021 by opening 30+ new locations. Grease Monkey® International, LLC is the nation’s largest independent franchisor of automotive oil change centers serving more than 2 million customers each year.
Our Grease Monkey® Certified Pit Crews offer customers a service experience that is unrivaled in the automotive industry. Our highly trained technicians are certified using our proprietary Grease Monkey® Technician Training & Certification Program. Grease Monkey® certified pit crews offer drivers an exceptional experience, delivered with speed and precision.

We locally own 5 Grease Monkey and SpeeDee Oil Change locations in Covington, Baton Rouge, Metairie and Kenner and opening more locations this year. we are in need of an intelligent, smiling, always happy, positive cashier who has great verbal, language and communication skills. Come grow with us! 

Job Summary
The cashier is responsible for establishing and maintaining good customer relations and to accurately complete paperwork required to track and service customers.  Performs other duties not directly stated below, as instructed by either the Manager or Assistant Manager.
Employment Qualifications
  • Commitment to excellence at all levels of service
  • Retail experience, automotive experience helpful
  • Good communication skills, cheerful and friendly
  •  Enthusiastic attitude and good work ethic
  •  Basic computer and office management skills
  • Clean and neat appearance, good telephone voice
Responsibilities 
Customer Relations / Business Development
  • Greets and interacts with the customers in a friendly, professional, and inviting manner
  •  Explains the SpeeDee Franchise Organization preventative maintenance services and pricing structure in order to achieve high customer satisfaction and increased sales.
  • Reviews services performed and bills out the customer
  • Obtains any technical information from manager or tune-up technicians in response to questions from customers
  •  Presents all promotional materials to customers
  •  Maintains marketing programs as directed by manager
  •  Answers telephone in an approved manner
  • Works to maintain a team effort of quality customer service
Shop Operations
  • Maintains spotless customer service/office area
  • Maintains spotless customer restrooms
  • Greets and writes up work orders for customers when business trends dictate the need
  • Conforms to the standards and procedures prescribed by the SpeeDee Franchise Organization Daily Operations Manual and store policies
  • Maintains appointment scheduler
  • Maintains operations of office computer system and daily cash receipts 
Benefits/Perks
 
  • Growth Opportunities 
  • Locally Owned and Operated
  • Life/Dental/Vision
  • FREE Lunches **
  • Weekly Bonus potential
  • Safety You can Trust

FUTURE OPENING

Store Hours: Monday - Saturday 9:00 am – 6:30 pm; Sunday Closed

Sweet Perks:

Position Summary:
The Nothing Bundt Cakes (NbC) Guest Service Representative creates a warm, welcoming environment for our guests, offers creative solutions for unique celebratory occasions and sells our delicious cakes. The Guest Service Representative is the first point of brand contact in our bakery and serves in an essential role to engage and bring joy to our guests, create a memorable experience and leave a positive, lasting impression.

Applicants must be 16 years of age or older.
 
Accountabilities/Duties: 
  • Promptly greets walk-in and phone guests with genuine warmth and helpful enthusiasm to determine interests and needs.
  • Maintains strong product knowledge to educate guests on NbC cake distinction, size and flavor profile options, pricing, special promotions, and complimentary retail merchandise.   
  • Suggests additional merchandise, including balloons, candles, and cards, to complete a unique celebration. 
  • Processes guest orders efficiently and accurately utilizing the point-of-sale system and invite guests to join NbC Email Club to benefit from special promotions and remain connected. 
  • Upholds a clean and organized bakery presentation, which may include routine sweeping/mopping of the floor, and dusting/cleaning of countertops, windows, and other surfaces. 
  • Replenishes retail merchandise and cake display case to ensure a strong visual presentation. 
  • Assists the Crafter in preparing cake decorations and packaging supplies as needed. 
  • Complies with all health and safety guidelines and NbC policies and procedures.
  • Maintains a consistent work attendance and punctuality record.  
 Core Values and Competencies: 
  • Servant’s Heart
  • Spirit of a Champion 
  • Genuine Connections 
Desirable Traits:
  • Exhibits high energy and strong interpersonal skills; is friendly, helpful, positive, patient, socially confident and communicative. 
  • Enjoys interacting with people and excels at providing a superior guest experience.   
  • Is organized and self-motivated.  
  • Is comfortable with new technology and has the ability to operate a point-of-sale system. 
  • Has the capacity to stand for extended periods of time and work in a fast-paced environment. 
Work Availability: 
Must have the flexibility to work various shifts, including early mornings, evenings, weekends and holidays, based on changing business demands.

The Nothing Bundt Cakes (NbC) Guest Service Representative creates a warm, welcoming environment for our guests, offers creative solutions for unique celebratory occasions and sells our delicious cakes. The Guest Service Representative is the first point of brand contact in our bakery and serves in an essential role to engage and bring joy to our guests, create a memorable experience and leave a positive, lasting impression. The Guest Service Representative embodies NbC core values and demonstrates a strong commitment to guest satisfaction as well as excellence and efficiency in the workplace.
 
Accountabilities/Duties: 
  • Promptly greets walk-in and phone guests with genuine warmth and helpful enthusiasm to determine interests and needs, and follows NbC Sweet Steps of Service to create a superior guest experience.   
  • Maintains strong product knowledge to educate guests on NbC cake distinction, size and flavor profile options, pricing, special promotions, and complimentary retail merchandise.   
  • Suggests additional merchandise, including balloons, candles, and cards, to complete a unique celebration. 
  • Processes guest orders efficiently and accurately utilizing the point-of-sale system and invite guests to join NbC Email Club to benefit from special promotions and remain connected. 
  • Upholds a clean and organized bakery presentation, which may include routine sweeping/mopping of the floor, and dusting/cleaning of countertops, windows, and other surfaces. 
  • Replenishes retail merchandise and cake display case to ensure a strong visual presentation. 
  • Assists the Crafter in preparing cake decorations and packaging supplies as needed. 
  • Complies with all health and safety guidelines and NbC policies and procedures, including strict adherence to dress code and personal hygiene.  
  • Maintains a consistent work attendance and punctuality record.  
 
Core Values and Competencies: 
  • Servant’s Heart
    • Goes above and beyond to support the team or guest, and is reliable, trustworthy and responsive. 
    • Keeps the good of the team or guest ahead of personal interests or gain. 
    • Displays humility and empathy in interactions with others.
  • Spirit of a Champion 
    • Demonstrates pride in responsibilities, an intense drive and a passion to succeed. 
    • Takes initiative and 100% ownership of responsibilities, with zero excuses for issues within direct control.  
    • Operates with a strong sense of urgency and adheres to NbC brand standards.
  • Genuine Connections 
    • Projects warmth, enthusiasm, and optimism that attracts others. 
    • Builds positive, productive relationships with all team members. 
    • Listens actively and communicates openly, clearly and respectfully. 
 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
  • Exhibits high energy and strong interpersonal skills; is friendly, helpful, positive, patient, socially confident and communicative. 
  • Enjoys interacting with diverse people and excels at providing a superior guest experience.  
  • Can perform multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining meticulous attention to detail. 
  • Is diligent, organized and self-motivated.  
  • Has the ability to understand and carry out oral and written instructions and request clarification when needed.
  • Is comfortable with new technology and has the ability to operate a point-of-sale system. 
  • Understands basic arithmetic; can perform calculations when needed and provide monetary change using U.S. currency. 
  • Has the capacity to stand for extended periods of time and work in a fast-paced environment. 
 
Education, Certifications and Work Experience Requirements:
  • Applicants must be 16 years of age or older. 
  • While no formal education or work experience is required, previous guest service experience at a bakery, restaurant or retail store is a plus.  
 
Work Availability: 
Must have the flexibility to work various shifts, including early mornings, evenings, weekends and holidays, based on changing business demands.

At Nothing Bundt Cakes, the Guest Services Representative sweetens up the place,
setting the mood and making a stop in the bakery an event worth posting about. You’ll
get to play party planner by helping guests order the right cake for their celebrations
and making sure their orders go off without a hitch. You’ll make everyone feel
welcome, and you’ll create an environment of generosity, happiness, and joy in your
community.

But it gets even better:

We close early so you can enjoy your evenings.
We offer flexible work schedules.
We’re keeping it casual. T-shirts and sneakers are where it’s at!
Cake discounts. Yummm!
You don’t have to be 18 to work here, so students can join us.
This job is fun. It’s literally a piece of cake!
This is a great place to make new friends!
You’ll get trained. Not only on crafting cake, but on growing your career.
We love to celebrate and bring joy to the community.

Apply now. Joy is the job.

Position Summary Statement: The Cashier/Guest Services/Expo position is critical to the daily success of the restaurant. We are looking for dependable people who want to work in a fast paced team environment. Candidates for this job MUST love interacting with people. We are a people focused business that is open late. We serve food until 1:00 am Sunday to Wednesday and until 3:00 am Thursday, Friday and Saturday. If you are tired of feeling undervalued you have found your next job. We are looking for enthusiastic people who can join our team and grow with us.  Apply TODAY and be a part of Late Night Done Right!

 

Job Requirements:

 

  • Great attitude is a MUST
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent menu and product knowledge upon training
  • Accountable for the preparation of the guest’s order.
  • Able to communicate effectively with guests and handle questions and concerns in a professional manner.
  • Team player.
  • Participates in all Fat Shack® sponsored initiatives.
  • Maintains an organized, stocked, and sanitary work space.
  • Maintains a safe work environment, adhering to all established food and safety guidelines.
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs.

We are looking for enthusiastic people to can join our team and grow with us.  Apply TODAY and be a part of Late Night Done Right!

 

Job Requirements:

 

  • Great attitude is a MUST
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent menu and product knowledge upon training
  • Accountable for the preparation of the guest’s order.
  • Able to communicate effectively with guests and handle questions and concerns in a professional manner.
  • Team player.
  • Participates in all Fat Shack® sponsored initiatives.
  • Maintains an organized, stocked, and sanitary work space.
  • Maintains a safe work environment, adhering to all established food and safety guidelines.
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs.

Golden Corral of Rocky Mount is currently seeking energetic, friendly individuals to join our team!   

Entering and leaving Golden Corral are two of the most critical moments in the guest’s experience because lasting impressions are formed during these moments.  The Cashier / Host’s interactions with our guests and these impressions ultimately dictate whether the guest will return.
Guest Service:
  • Greets guests as they enter the restaurant and offers a sincere, personal invitation to return as the guests leave.
  • Offers assistance to any guests who may need help.
  • Processes GC On the Go To-Go orders.
  • Friendly and courteous on the phone.
  • Handles payments accurately.
  • Knows and follows position responsibilities as they relate to just-in-time delivery.
  • Knows what is on buffet for the day and has a full knowledge of menu and prices.
Cleanliness:
  • Maintains organization and cleanliness at the vestibule, host/cashier station and surrounding areas.
  • May help ensure the buffet is set up properly and labels are correct.  Cleans all buffets and surrounding areas.
  • Follows local health department laws.
  • Performs duty roster and ensures cleanliness, service, and quality standards are met.
Operational Excellence:
  • Informs the Manager when the money in the drawer needs to be taken to the safe to reduce the risk of robbery.
  • Ensures drawer balances with daily paperwork.
Thank you for your interest in Golden Corral. Upon completion of your online application, you may be directed to complete an additional online questionnaire that is specific to the position in which you are applying.

FT, Mon-Sun, Flexible schedule, Pay based on Experience, Medical, Dental, Vision, Simple IRA, Meal Discount. Career Advancement available.
PT is available as well. Benefits for Full Time only.

Our Golden Corral franchise is currently seeking energetic, friendly individuals to join our team!   

The Cashier / Host’s interactions with our guests are integral in the guest experience in our restaurant.
Arriving and leaving Golden Corral are two of the most critical moments in the guest’s experience because lasting impressions are formed during these moments, therefor a positive first impression and experience is key!  

Guest Service:

  • Greets guests as they enter the restaurant and offers a sincere, personal invitation to return as the guests leave.
  • Offers assistance to any guests who may need help.
  • Processes GC On the Go To-Go orders.
  • Friendly and courteous on the phone.
  • Handles payments accurately.
  • Knows what is on buffet for the day and has a full knowledge of menu and prices.
Cleanliness:

  • Maintains organization and cleanliness at the  host/cashier station and surrounding areas.
  • Help ensure the buffet is set up properly and labels are correct.  Cleans all buffets and surrounding areas.
  • Follows local health department laws.
  • Ensures cleanliness, service, and quality standards are met.
Operational Excellence:

  • Informs the Manager when the money in the drawer needs to be taken to the safe to reduce the risk of robbery.
  • Ensures drawer balances with daily paperwork.
Thank you for your interest in Golden Corral. Upon completion of your online application, you may be directed to complete an additional online questionnaire that is specific to the position in which you are applying.

We are looking for a customer-focused Host/ Cashier to join our team! You will be welcoming guests, seating them in the restaurant and entering orders into the POS system.

You are a natural people person who can quickly build rapport with guests and create a welcoming atmosphere. Detail-oriented and able to manage multiple priorities, you rely on your excellent organization and communication skills to answer phone calls, ring in guest orders and answer questions about our menu.

Responsibilities: 
  •  Greet guests and direst them to Dine in, Full Service or Take out areas
  •  Inform guests of current Daily Specials.
  •  Manage the flow of guests into the dining and bar areas, provide accurate wait times to incoming guests if appropriate
  •  Operate cash registers to accept payments for food and beverages
  •  Answer the phone.
  •  Take to-go orders when necessary.
  •  Keep the host stand neat, tidy, and presentable for guests.
Qualifications: 
  •  Previous restaurant hosting or serving experience preferred 
  •  Friendly and customer-focused personality 
  •  Ability to articulate clear greetings and farewells to guests, as well as being able to understand requests for assistance
  •  Ability to clearly communicate guests’ needs to Servers, Bussers, Managers, etc.
  •  Ability to effectively communicate on the telephone
  •  Must be able to carry trays or supplies (10-30 lbs.)
 
Complete our short application today!

Our franchise organization, {{ account.name }}, is currently seeking energetic, friendly individuals to join our team!   
Entering and leaving Golden Corral are two of the most critical moments in the guest’s experience because lasting impressions are formed during these moments.  The Cashier / Host’s interactions with our guests and these impressions ultimately dictate whether the guest will return.
Guest Service:
  • Greets guests as they enter the restaurant and offers a sincere, personal invitation to return as the guests leave.
  • Offers assistance to any guests who may need help.
  • Processes GC On the Go To-Go orders.
  • Friendly and courteous on the phone.
  • Handles payments accurately.
  • Knows and follows position responsibilities as they relate to just-in-time delivery.
  • Knows what is on buffet for the day and has a full knowledge of menu and prices.
Cleanliness:
  • Maintains organization and cleanliness at the vestibule, host/cashier station and surrounding areas.
  • May help ensure the buffet is set up properly and labels are correct.  Cleans all buffets and surrounding areas.
  • Follows local health department laws.
  • Performs duty roster and ensures cleanliness, service, and quality standards are met.
Operational Excellence:
  • Informs the Manager when the money in the drawer needs to be taken to the safe to reduce the risk of robbery.
  • Ensures drawer balances with daily paperwork.
Thank you for your interest in Golden Corral. Upon completion of your online application, you may be directed to complete an additional online questionnaire that is specific to the position in which you are applying.

Our franchise organization, {{ account.name }}, is currently seeking energetic, friendly individuals to join our team!   

Entering and leaving Golden Corral are two of the most critical moments in the guest’s experience because lasting impressions are formed during these moments.  The Cashier / Host’s interactions with our guests and these impressions ultimately dictate whether the guest will return.

Guest Service:

  • Greets guests as they enter the restaurant and offers a sincere, personal invitation to return as the guests leave.
  • Offers assistance to any guests who may need help.
  • Processes GC On the Go To-Go orders.
  • Friendly and courteous on the phone.
  • Handles payments accurately.
  • Knows and follows position responsibilities as they relate to just-in-time delivery.
  • Knows what is on buffet for the day and has a full knowledge of menu and prices.

Cleanliness:

  • Maintains organization and cleanliness at the vestibule, host/cashier station and surrounding areas.
  • May help ensure the buffet is set up properly and labels are correct.  Cleans all buffets and surrounding areas.
  • Follows local health department laws.
  • Performs duty roster and ensures cleanliness, service, and quality standards are met.

Operational Excellence:

  • Informs the Manager when the money in the drawer needs to be taken to the safe to reduce the risk of robbery.
  • Ensures drawer balances with daily paperwork.

Thank you for your interest in Golden Corral. Upon completion of your online application, you may be directed to complete an additional online questionnaire that is specific to the position in which you are applying.

Our franchise organization, {{ account.name }}, is currently seeking energetic, friendly individuals to join our team!   
Entering and leaving Golden Corral are two of the most critical moments in the guest’s experience because lasting impressions are formed during these moments.  The Cashier / Host’s interactions with our guests and these impressions ultimately dictate whether the guest will return.
Guest Service:
  • Greets guests as they enter the restaurant and offers a sincere, personal invitation to return as the guests leave.
  • Offers assistance to any guests who may need help.
  • Processes GC On the Go To-Go orders.
  • Friendly and courteous on the phone.
  • Handles payments accurately.
  • Knows and follows position responsibilities as they relate to just-in-time delivery.
  • Knows what is on buffet for the day and has a full knowledge of menu and prices.
Cleanliness:
  • Maintains organization and cleanliness at the vestibule, host/cashier station and surrounding areas.
  • May help ensure the buffet is set up properly and labels are correct.  Cleans all buffets and surrounding areas.
  • Follows local health department laws.
  • Performs duty roster and ensures cleanliness, service, and quality standards are met.
Operational Excellence:
  • Informs the Manager when the money in the drawer needs to be taken to the safe to reduce the risk of robbery.
  • Ensures drawer balances with daily paperwork.
Thank you for your interest in Golden Corral. Upon completion of your online application, you may be directed to complete an additional online questionnaire that is specific to the position in which you are applying.

Our franchise organization, {{ account.name }}, is currently seeking energetic, friendly individuals to join our team!   
Entering and leaving Golden Corral are two of the most critical moments in the guest’s experience because lasting impressions are formed during these moments.  The Cashier / Host’s interactions with our guests and these impressions ultimately dictate whether the guest will return.
Guest Service:
  • Greets guests as they enter the restaurant and offers a sincere, personal invitation to return as the guests leave.
  • Offers assistance to any guests who may need help.
  • Processes GC On the Go To-Go orders.
  • Friendly and courteous on the phone.
  • Handles payments accurately.
  • Knows and follows position responsibilities as they relate to just-in-time delivery.
  • Knows what is on buffet for the day and has a full knowledge of menu and prices.
Cleanliness:
  • Maintains organization and cleanliness at the vestibule, host/cashier station and surrounding areas.
  • May help ensure the buffet is set up properly and labels are correct.  Cleans all buffets and surrounding areas.
  • Follows local health department laws.
  • Performs duty roster and ensures cleanliness, service, and quality standards are met.
Operational Excellence:
  • Informs the Manager when the money in the drawer needs to be taken to the safe to reduce the risk of robbery.
  • Ensures drawer balances with daily paperwork.
Thank you for your interest in Golden Corral. Upon completion of your online application, you may be directed to complete an additional online questionnaire that is specific to the position in which you are applying.

Golden Corral Corporation does not hire or employ any individuals at this franchise location. The franchisee will make all decisions with respect to applications for the position listed on this page. The name of the franchisee appears in this job posting. All questions concerning this job opportunity should be directed to the franchisee.

Benefits/Perks

  • Great pay
  • Flexible schedules
  • Fun, friendly team environment
  • Training aimed at advancement
  • Recognition for achievement
  • FastTracks training Program
  • Discounts on meals 
  • New Store Opening
Responsibilities

  • Food Prep, Cooking, Cleaning, Serving, Cashier
  • Being on time in complete uniform 
  • Taking care of guest
  • Making sure we do everything we can to have our guest return.
Requirements

  • Must be 16 years or older 
  • US Work eligibility 
  • Experience is a plus not not required (onsite training)
About Us

  • Fast pace environment 
  • Leaders in the restaurant industry
  • Great hands on experience ​
  • Friendly honest, hardworking leadership
  • Golden Corral restaurants are currently accepting applications for the opportunity to join our team with our family buffet restaurant chain with nearly 500 company and franchise restaurants located across the United States. Come join our team while contributing to our vision “To be the leader in family dining by making pleasurable dining affordable to every guest, at every restaurant, every day.”

Cashier Job Description

General Description: 

The Cashier is the face of The Great Greek to our customers. A cashier needs to be outgoing, and friendly to ensure the best possible experience for each and every guest. To greet guests as they walk in, guide guests through the ordering process and suggestively sell all menu items. Efficiently use menu screens to ring up customers correctly. Cashiers must be able to communicate well with others and handle themselves professionally in high stress situations.


Job Requirements: 
  • Greet and serve all guests
  • Accurate cash handling and credit card procedures
  • Accurate order taking, includes repeating order to customer at time of order and delivery of food.
  • Be able to explain the menu and suggestively sell and up sell to all customers.
  • Setting up or closing down the dining room, restrooms, and patios
  • Answering the phones using all aspects of The Great Greek script requirements and taking call in orders
  • Directing customers inside the restaurant
  • Helping pre-bus and cleaning the dining room during service while not on the register
  • Maintaining a clean and sanitary work area as outlined by city health codes
  • Assist with opening and closing restaurant duties and re-stocking.
  • Smile, be friendly, and polite
  • Be able to work the expo window when needed.

Qualifications: 
  • Minimum age: 18 years 
  • Able to follow instructions accurately and efficiently
  • Able to perform well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Reliable transportation 
  • Able to lift a minimum of 20 lbs 

Education Background: 
  • High School Diploma

Schedule/Compensation: 
  • Part-time/Hourly
  • 10-40 hours weekly.

Our Values: Genuine Hospitality, Employee Development, Growth & Profitability, Operational Excellence, Products & Safety, Community Involvement 

About the Hourly Team Member position: 
• Be prepared to smile! Happy team members make for happy customers. 
• Ditch the outdated uniform! Our hourly team members wear jeans and t-shirts. 
• We’re a no grease zone! You won’t go home smelling like an old French fry. Our work environment is clean and safe. 
• This job is fun and flexible! You’ve got a life outside of work and we want you to live it fully. 
• Get ready to learn and grow! Want to advance in your career? We can’t wait to help you do just that. 

Job Requirements: 
• Greet and interact with guests 
• Sell, serve and prepare our delicious menu items 
• Prepare the restaurant to be a welcoming environment for each and every guest

Bring the Joy!

MUST HAVE AFTERNOON AND SATURDAY AVAILABILITY

At Nothing Bundt Cakes, the Guest Services Representative sweetens up the place, setting the mood and making a stop in the bakery an event worth posting about. You’ll get to play party planner by helping guests order the right cake for their celebrations and making sure their orders go off without a hitch. You’ll make everyone feel welcomed, and you’ll create an environment of generosity, happiness, and joy in your community. But it gets even better:

·  Enjoy your evenings: We close earlier than most food service jobs. 

·  We offer flexible work schedules. 

·  We’re keeping it casual. T-shirts and sneakers are where it’s at!  

·  Cake discounts. Yummm!  

·  You don’t have to be 18 to work here, so students can join us. 

·  This job is fun. It’s literally a piece of cake! 

·  This is a great place to make new friends! 

·  You’ll get trained. Not only on crafting cake, but on growing your career. 

·  We love to celebrate and bring joy to the community.

 

Apply now. Joy is the job.

The Nothing Bundt Cakes (NbC) Guest Service Representative creates a warm, welcoming environment for our guests, offers creative solutions for unique celebratory occasions and sells our delicious cakes. The Guest Service Representative is the first point of brand contact in our bakery and serves in an essential role to engage and bring joy to our guests, create a memorable experience and leave a positive, lasting impression. The Guest Service Representative embodies NbC core values and demonstrates a strong commitment to guest satisfaction as well as excellence and efficiency in the workplace.
 
Accountabilities/Duties: 
  • Promptly greets walk-in and phone guests with genuine warmth and helpful enthusiasm to determine interests and needs, and follows NbC Sweet Steps of Service to create a superior guest experience.   
  • Maintains strong product knowledge to educate guests on NbC cake distinction, size and flavor profile options, pricing, special promotions, and complimentary retail merchandise.   
  • Suggests additional merchandise, including balloons, candles, and cards, to complete a unique celebration. 
  • Processes guest orders efficiently and accurately utilizing the point-of-sale system and invite guests to join NbC Email Club to benefit from special promotions and remain connected. 
  • Upholds a clean and organized bakery presentation, which may include routine sweeping/mopping of the floor, and dusting/cleaning of countertops, windows, and other surfaces. 
  • Replenishes retail merchandise and cake display case to ensure a strong visual presentation. 
  • Assists the Crafter in preparing cake decorations and packaging supplies as needed. 
  • Complies with all health and safety guidelines and NbC policies and procedures, including strict adherence to dress code and personal hygiene.  
  • Maintains a consistent work attendance and punctuality record.  
 
Core Values and Competencies: 
  • Servant’s Heart
    • Goes above and beyond to support the team or guest, and is reliable, trustworthy and responsive. 
    • Keeps the good of the team or guest ahead of personal interests or gain. 
    • Displays humility and empathy in interactions with others.
  • Spirit of a Champion 
    • Demonstrates pride in responsibilities, an intense drive and a passion to succeed. 
    • Takes initiative and 100% ownership of responsibilities, with zero excuses for issues within direct control.  
    • Operates with a strong sense of urgency and adheres to NbC brand standards.
  • Genuine Connections 
    • Projects warmth, enthusiasm, and optimism that attracts others. 
    • Builds positive, productive relationships with all team members. 
    • Listens actively and communicates openly, clearly and respectfully. 
 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
  • Exhibits high energy and strong interpersonal skills; is friendly, helpful, positive, patient, socially confident and communicative. 
  • Enjoys interacting with diverse people and excels at providing a superior guest experience.  
  • Can perform multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining meticulous attention to detail. 
  • Is diligent, organized and self-motivated.  
  • Has the ability to understand and carry out oral and written instructions and request clarification when needed.
  • Is comfortable with new technology and has the ability to operate a point-of-sale system. 
  • Understands basic arithmetic; can perform calculations when needed and provide monetary change using U.S. currency. 
  • Has the capacity to stand for extended periods of time and work in a fast-paced environment. 
 
Education, Certifications and Work Experience Requirements:
  • Applicants must be 16 years of age or older. 
  • While no formal education or work experience is required, previous guest service experience at a bakery, restaurant or retail store is a plus.  
 
Work Availability: 
Must have the flexibility to work various shifts, including early mornings, evenings, weekends and holidays, based on changing business demands.

Company Overview
Founded in 1978 and headquartered in Denver, Colorado, the Grease Monkey® brand currently operates more than 300 centers internationally with operations in Mexico, China, Colombia and Saudi Arabia. Grease Monkey® is the nation’s largest independent franchisor of automotive oil change centers and is looking to expand in 2021 by opening 30+ new locations. Grease Monkey® International, LLC is the nation’s largest independent franchisor of automotive oil change centers serving more than 2 million customers each year.
Our Grease Monkey® Certified Pit Crews offer customers a service experience that is unrivaled in the automotive industry. Our highly trained technicians are certified using our proprietary Grease Monkey® Technician Training & Certification Program. Grease Monkey® certified pit crews offer drivers an exceptional experience, delivered with speed and precision.
Position Overview 
The Customer Service Specialist is responsible for all aspects of customer service in a Grease Monkey center, and light clerical duties. This is an hourly position. 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities 
Provide Exceptional Customer Service 
  • Maintain communications with waiting customers, keep them informed of wait times, answer questions. Answer telephone, direct calls, and answer customer inquiries. 
  • Educate customers regarding the condition of fluids and filters, services available, promotions, and product guarantees. 
  • Remind customers to submit feedback about their visit. 
  • Thank all departing customers, remind them to return. 
  • Review Service Order Ticket thoroughly with customers at check-out, explain services performed, purpose of static sticker, and reminder card.
  • Process all payments using the computer system and credit card machine. 
  • Perform courtesy work when needed. 
  • Assist manager in resolving customer complaints. 
Maintain Customer Waiting Area 
  • Make coffee; keep fresh coffee available at all times. 
  • Clean and straighten the coffee service area. Clean and straighten waiting room chairs and tables. Clean waiting area restrooms, and stock restroom supplies a minimum of three times during the day. 
  • Stock and maintain current reading materials ensuring it is appropriate for children. Stock supply of cups, creamer, sugar, and stirrers. 
Maintain Front Office Area 
  • Clean and straighten countertop and desk. Clean computer and equipment. File and organize paperwork (assist manager). 
  • Stock Service Order Tickets. 
  • Input vendor shipments on computer
Other Duties and Responsibilities 
  • Place customer quality assurance calls, write customer thank you notes. 
  • General center maintenance and cleaning duties. 
  • Attend crew meetings as required. 
  • Run errands and perform other duties as assigned by a Supervisor. 
Job Qualifications 
  • Excellent customer service skills 
  • Basic literacy (ready, writing, math skills), Verbal and written communication skills, Keyboarding skills, Beginning computing skills 
  • Attention to detail and accuracy 
  • Previous customer service and general office experience necessary 
Working Conditions 
Equipment Used: Computer. Environment: Some exposure to outside weather elements, noise, and vehicle exhaust fumes throughout the entire shift. 
Physical Activities: Position requires good corrected vision, hearing, frequent standing, walking, climbing, stooping, crouching, handling, reaching, and keyboarding.
Benefits/Perks
  • Discounted Services for Employees
  • Flexible Hours
  • Opportunities for Advancement

Company Overview
Our first SpeeDee Oil Change opened in December 1980 in Metairie, Louisiana. 
SpeeDee swiftly grew into a quick lube and automotive tune-up service business, and by the mid-90s, SpeeDee had added complete brake service and grown to a full-service auto maintenance and repair facility.
For 40 years, SpeeDee has built trusted customer relationships based on reliability and professional service and grown from a single store to more than 150 locations. 
How Are We Different From the Competition?
  • Local Ownership
  • Quality Service
  • Training and Certification
  • Multi-Point Courtesy Check and Service Review
  • Free Top-Off Service
  • Maintenance Records
  • Affordable Rates
Job Summary
The cashier is responsible for establishing and maintaining good customer relations and to accurately complete paperwork required to track and service customers.  Performs other duties not directly stated below, as instructed by either the Manager or Assistant Manager.
Employment Qualifications
  • Commitment to excellence at all levels of service
  • Retail experience, automotive experience helpful
  • Good communication skills, cheerful and friendly
  •  Enthusiastic attitude and good work ethic
  •  Basic computer and office management skills
  • Clean and neat appearance, good telephone voice
Responsibilities 
Customer Relations / Business Development
  • Greets and interacts with the customers in a friendly, professional, and inviting manner
  •  Explains the SpeeDee Franchise Organization preventative maintenance services and pricing structure in order to achieve high customer satisfaction and increased sales.
  • Reviews services performed and bills out the customer
  • Obtains any technical information from manager or tune-up technicians in response to questions from customers
  •  Presents all promotional materials to customers
  •  Maintains marketing programs as directed by manager
  •  Answers telephone in an approved manner
  • Works to maintain a team effort of quality customer service
Shop Operations
  • Maintains spotless customer service/office area
  • Maintains spotless customer restrooms
  • Greets and writes up work orders for customers when business trends dictate the need
  • Conforms to the standards and procedures prescribed by the SpeeDee Franchise Organization Daily Operations Manual and store policies
  • Maintains appointment scheduler
  • Maintains operations of office computer system and daily cash receipts 
Benefits/Perks
 
  • Growth Opportunities 
  • Locally Owned and Operated
  • Safety You can Trust

Join the Mr. Fries Man team and assist us in our goal to create a quality work environment, delicious food, and a great dining experience. You will be joining a new dynamic fast-food chain that started in Los Angeles and now has made its way to Greenville, South Carolina.

Mr. Fries Man is a family-owned restaurant part of a revolutionary underground foodie frenzy that started in Los Angeles. In 2016, Craig Batiste, co-owner along with his wife Dorothy, is one of several urban chefs in LA that have worked their way up from a home kitchen to a restaurant in Gardena, CA. Their strong social media presence captivated their audience, which resulted in a remarkable following. After a few years of operation, they decided to open up to franchising across the country. The Greenville, SC location is the first location in the state of South Carolina.


Position Summary
  • To represent Mr. Fries Man in a professional manner to reflect values and standards of its mission, goals, and values.
  • To provide friendly, responsive, and exceptional customer service to all Mr. Fries Man guests.
  • To take customer orders using point of sale system and complete guest transactions.
Essential Responsibilities
  • Greets customers.
  • Receives payment by cash, check, credit cards, vouchers, or automatic debits.
  • Issues receipts, refunds, credits, or change to customers.
  • Counts money in cash drawers at the beginning of shifts to ensure that amounts are correct and that there is adequate change.
  • Calculates total payments received during a time period and reconciles this with total sales.
  • Takes necessary meal and rest breaks accordingly. 
  • Clocks in and out of the restaurant in a timely manner. 
  • Assist customers by providing information and resolving their complaints.
  • Maintains clean and orderly checkout area.
  • Attends all scheduled team meetings/training and brings suggestions for improvements.
  • Other duties as assigned by Mr. Fries Man.
  • The company reserves the right to add or change duties at any time.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Maintain quality work environment and good relationships with team members.
  • Possess and instill high quality standards for production and guest service.
  • Detail oriented, organized, and efficient.
  • Responsible for following all safety and security procedures, as directed by Mr. Fries Man policy. 
  • Effective communication skills.
  • Exhibit courteous, friendly, and professional service to guests.
  • Trustworthy and reliable.
  • Possess strong basic math skills and can operate a cash register or Point Of Sale system. 
  • Must be able to communicate (speak, read, write) in the primary language of the work location.
Education/Experience Requirements
  • High School Diploma or GED preferred but not required
  • Restaurant experience preferred but not required
  • Cash handling experience a plus
  • Knowledge of TOAST POS system preferred not required
  • Current and valid Food Handler’s Certificate
  • Must be 16 years of age or older
Physical Demands

Stands/walks continuously (up to 5 hours) through the shift. Frequent bending, bend and twist neck and waist, reach above and below shoulders and squat, use hands, reaching or grasping with hands and arms. Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds on a regular basis and occasionally up to 50 pounds. Must be able to work under pressure and be flexible to work long, sometimes irregular hours including weekends and holidays.

Working Environment

Must comply with Company’s Appearance and Dress Code standard as set forth in the Employee Handbook. Works primarily in the kitchen, where air may be moist, warm, and odorous from cooking foods. Kitchen floors are uneven and may be slippery from moisture and grease.

Benefits
  • Employee discount 
  • Flexible schedule
  • Opportunity for advancement
Supplemental pay types
  • Tips
Work Location
95 Halton Road Greenville SC 29607

Full time or part time. 

Summary:
A zpizza Tap Room’s first responsibility is to provide guests with exceptional
customer service while monitoring use of the self pour beer tap system. They are
responsible for keeping certain parts of the restaurant in top condition (including
the dining room, glassware station, and beer pour system) for guests and for
following safe food handling practices when running food and handling
glassware. They assist guests with beer and food knowledge and make sure they
have everything necessary during their visit. They use the point of sale system
and are responsible for following safe cash handling procedures. Attention to
detail, teamwork, and overall responsibility are important parts of this position.
 
Overview of primary responsibilities:
  1. Exhibits a cheerful and helpful manner with guests.
  2. Demonstrates a complete understanding of menu items and explains it to
    guests accurately and enthusiastically.
  3. Demonstrates a complete understanding of liquor laws and service.
  4. Demonstrates a complete understanding of the self pour beer tap system.
  5. Supports guest through dining experience including providing
    plates/silverware, pre-bussing, and providing guidance on proper beer
    pouring.
  6. Cleans as directed.
  7. Uses Point of Sale system/cash register to take the order and complete
    payment and set up alcohol pour tabs. Accounts for all forms of money
    during the shift.
  8. Understands and adheres to proper food handling, safety and sanitization
    standards while preparing food, serving food, and clean up.
  9. Maintains professional appearance and grooming standards
  10. Performs light paperwork duties.
  11. Is a team player and willing to assist other members with their duties.
 
Requirements:
  • Previous restaurant or customer service experience a plus.
  • Ability to read, write, and speak English.
  • Must meet age requirements for alcohol service as per local laws.
Daytime Cashiers

Please note: We'd love to chat, but due to our heavy demand for serving guests please email cristina@cfaina.com instead of calling, for any questions or follow-up in regards to your application.

A job at Chick-fil-A Ina is more than just a job. It is a career-focused platform that's dedicated to your personal growth and development. It’s a career that strives for excellence every day and cares for everyone.

As a Front Team Member you will be responsible for:

  • Taking great care of our Customers. Our Team Members are genuinely friendly and passionate about service. They not only satisfy Customer requests but also anticipate our Customers’ needs. Some of the ways we serve our Customers include smiling, providing a sincere greeting, delivering food to tables, asking Customers about their meal and clearing their trays, and thanking them for their visit.
  • Receiving and entering Customer orders with a smile and processing payments using the register/ IPOS at the counter or in the drive-through 
  • Expediting/bagging
  • Team Members also serve as a final quality control check and only hands out products that meets Chick-Fil-A Ina standards.
  • Delivering meals to guests 
  • Assisting with guests' needs 
  • Maintaining a sparkling clean dining room with a welcoming atmosphere. 
  • Monitor and clean the playground, restrooms, outdoor patio, and parking lot. 
  • Share and answer questions about the Chick-fil-A brand, food products, Chick-fil-A One app, catering, and current marketing campaign support
  • Collaborate with team members and fulfill our mission: Excellence every day & Care for everyone 

Qualifications and Skills
  • A genuine smile!
  • Good communication skills.
  • Dependable
  • Excited to come to work
  • Enjoys being a part of a team
  • Ability to work days, nights, weekends, and holidays
  • Strong work ethic
  • A qualified candidate must be 16 years of age or older and authorized to work in the U.S.
  • A qualified candidate must have the ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds for brief and short distances.
  • Candidates with open availability between 3 PM to 12 AM are highly preferred at this time.
Front Team Member positions will be expected to regularly work four-hour, six-hour, or eight-hour shifts, at various times within the various day parts of the morning (5:30 am - 2 pm), afternoon (11 am - 8 pm), or evening (3 pm-12 am), depending on the needs of the business and store performance goals.

A prime candidate will have availability during two, three, or all of these day part times on a regular daily basis. At this time we are prioritizing candidates who have availability between 3 PM to 12 AM. Candidates with restrictions on their availability between 3 PM to  12 AM will be considered at a later time. Availability can alternate throughout the week. A prime candidate will also have open weekend availability between Thursday - Saturday.


Salary: Front of the House Team Members can expect to make between $13.85 - $15.00, per hour

This is what our Team Members love about working at Chick-Fil-A Ina:
  • Free Online College
  • 50% Discount for you, family, and friends
  • 401 K (after meeting eligibility requirements)
  • Up to $2500 Scholarship
  • Exclusive access to discounts including theme parks, event tickets, movie tickets, gifts, clothing, travel, auto buying, and more!
  • Flexible Scheduling
  • Free Meal
  • An upbeat, team-oriented atmosphere
  • Career development
  • Personal growth opportunities
  • Best-in-class training
  • A safe, respectful work environment
  • Full-time Team Members are eligible for medical benefits
  • Off on Sundays - We are closed on Sundays so you can have a day off to spend with family and friends.
  • And, importantly, the friendships they build with their team at  Store!
Our vision at Chick-Fil-A Ina is to be a distinctively better experience- and that means creating a great experience for you too!

Come and JOIN the Team!

Chick FIl-A Ina at Thornydale
3943 W In Road
Tucson, AZ 85741

Job Title: Cashier

Reports to: Restaurant Manager & Shift Manager

The cashier is in charge of processing all food orders and reflecting a positive happy experience to all customers. As well as assisting in expediting orders, answering the phone to handle to-go orders.

Main Accountabilities 
  • In addition to following Salsa Fresca’s policies and procedures, main accountabilities are as follows: 
  • Maintain a friendly attitude at all times
  • Maintain an accurate drawer at all times
  • Upselling customers drinks, and extras
  • Promoting any current marketing initiatives
  • Assisting online and expediting orders and bagging to-go orders
  • Taking phone orders for pick up and delivery
  • Assist in opening and closing of  the store 
  • Perform any other tasks assigned by MOD
Required Skills & Abilities:

  • Motivated
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Cover shifts when needed
  • Understand all roles in the restaurant
  • Strong ability to identify issues and resolve them efficiently through proper channels
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Demonstrate good personal hygiene
Some perks of joining our team include:

  • Employee discount
  • Free meals
  • Paid time off for full time employees
  • Tips
  • Flexible schedule
To apply, please call Lester at 475-529-7063 or apply here.

Se habla español.

REPORTS TO: General Manager/Assistant Manager/Shift Leader
 
Position Summary Statement: The line positions are critical to the daily success of the restaurant. Part of our mission is to serve hearty and flavorful food, and it has to be done right! The line is just that…the front lines of our operation and standards must be exceeded to ensure we execute on our mission.
 
Job Requirements:
 
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent menu and product knowledge.
  • Accountable for the preparation of the guest’s order.
  • Ability to support fundraising initiatives.
  • Proficient use of the POS system.
  • Accuracy of the cash drawer
  • Able to communicate effectively with guests and handle questions and concerns in a professional manner.
  • Team player. Able to handle cash and credit card transaction.
  • Thanks the guest sincerely for their business.
  • Participates in all Firehouse Subs® Public Safety Foundation fundraising initiatives.
  • Maintains an organized, stocked, and sanitary work space.
  • Able and willing to complete other restaurant functions such as cashier or cleaning, per management direction, or any other duties assigned by the general manager, assistant manager, or shift leader.
  • Maintains a safe work environment, adhering to all established food and safety guidelines.
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs.
Our employees enjoy:
Competitive hourly wages and Tips
Friendly, team-oriented environment
Excellent growth opportunities
Flexible Schedule

We are looking for an experienced team member to join our team! You will be helping to create exceptional experiences for our customers during their dining experience with us by taking and serving food and drink orders and resolving customer issues. 
 
You are passionate about food and dining and share that passion by going above and beyond for customers. A natural people person with an eye for the details, you are looking to join a hard-working and efficient team that cares about great food and customer experience. 
 
Responsibilities: 
  • Take orders from customers for food and beverages
  • Check with customers to ensure that they are enjoying their meals and take action to correct any problems
  • Maintain a working knowledge of food and drink menu items, promotions, ingredients, and prep time
  • Communicate customer orders to kitchen staff 
  • Collect customer payments and provide change in a timely and courteous manner
Qualifications: 
  • Previous restaurant experience preferred 
  • Ability to stand, walk, and carry food trays for prolonged periods of time
  • Ability to effectively listen to and respond to customer needs
  • Must have a courteous, friendly and professional demeanor
  • Ability to multitask efficiently
 
Complete our short application today!

For over a century, Arthur Abbott's secret frozen custard recipe has delighted taste buds. First established in 1902 in Rochester, NY, Abbott's Frozen Custard can now be found in nearly 40 other locations across the nation. Abbott's handcrafted frozen concoctions are the perfect way to mark any occasion or event.  Win or lose, good day or bad, after the park or a picnic, going to Abbott’s “after” helps make everything even better.

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be directly responsible for:
  • The preparation and service of cones, dishes, sundaes, milkshakes and Flurries. 
  • Possess a working knowledge of proper ingredients and portion sizes as well as proper presentation for each of the menu items. 
  • Maintain a "Customer-first" attitude and approach in all your interactions and throughout your workday.
  • Provide respectful and timely service.
  • Process customer transactions, handling cash, and giving change
  • Following opening, closing and daily checklists. Performing and completing necessary tasks.
  • Performing specific cleaning & restocking tasks as assigned by the Manager on Duty.
  • Maintain a professional approach by arriving to work on time & wearing a clean uniform
In addition, frozen custard and all associated products are made fresh daily so the responsibilities and duties of the an employee will also include the following:

  • Becoming familiar with all areas involved with the Abbott’s custard machine 
  • Practicing proper mix handling and mixing techniques as well as following all recipe guidelines
  • Proper production of Abbott’s custard and product rotation
Requirements

  • Must be 18yrs. of age or older
  • Must be able to lift, handle, and carry, small wares and equipment weighing anywhere from 25 to 30 pounds
  • Must be able to communicate effectively and listen to managers, employees, and guests
  • Must be accepting of a flexible work schedule.

Cashier/Server/Sandwich Cook/Dishwasher is responsible for preparing sandwiches and salads in a fast food restaurant. Other duties also include ensuring that food safety standards are respected, colleting payments from customers, cleaning the working area, portioning food items, and maintaining stock. 

An active up to date Food Handlers Certificate is required.

Will train!  No experience necessary!

Make life more delicious! Exciting opportunity to join a growing local company with multiple locations! Fiorella's Cucina is seeking Bartenders for our Newton location. Fiorella's is a family owned and operated Italian restaurant dedicated to superior quality food and beverages, legendary customer service, and treating our team members like family. jobs_name: Cashier Serving Beer & Wine $17/hour PLUS TIPS!!
jobs_description:
Summary of Position:  

The Hospitality Associate will be displaying our core values when communicating with the guests and the team. The Hospitality Associate will ensure the guests have an exceptional dining and take-out experience with Fiorella’s. This role is responsible for managing the POS, answering telephone, and taking orders. 

 

Activities and Responsibilities:


I will… 

  • Greet guest-personally: learn to recognize regulars and greet all guests with a warm and welcoming smile. Make sure to acknowledge every guest when they walk through the door.
  • Embody Fiorella’s core values through constant and never ending learning from the Fiorella’s team. 
  • Validate guest experience by ensuring our guests enjoyed their meals, securing their return.
  • Build my legacy at Fiorella’s by making special bonds and memories with our guests and team. 
  • Communicate efficiently internally and externally to create an exceptional experience for our guests. 
  • Answer the phone as soon as possible (unless with another guest) in a professional manner in  accordance with our phone procedure and restaurant standards. Remember a guest can hear you smile through the phone!
  • Adhere to order accuracy standards with every interaction I have with a guest.
  • Follow our standards regarding any catering order requests.
  • Complete all daily and weekly side work for each shift.
  • Accurately and efficiently bag the orders for our guests following our bagging procedure. 
  • Manage the cash drawer, POS system, and process payments.
  • Maintain a general working knowledge of restaurant information such as: restaurant hours, along with the addresses & phone numbers for the other Fiorella’s locations.
  • Display teamwork with all positions to adhere to all restaurant standards.
  • Report all equipment problems and maintenance issues to the manager on duty.
  • Make sure the front of the house is clean and orderly at all times.
  • Inform guests of new products,  promotions, and specials.
  • Enhance the dining experience for our guests by being able to make appropriate suggestions/recommendations with my menu knowledge of each dish (ingredients and preparation). 
  • Be responsible for supporting and executing Fiorella’s marketing promotions and birthday club.  
  • Maintain communication among the team in regards to any relevant information or concerns.
  • Communicate health and/or safety concerns/violations immediately to the supervisor.
  • Provide partial table service to on-site guests.
  • Adhere to the restaurant guidelines of food, safety, and sanitation provided by the health department.
  • Understand all policies, procedures, and service standards of the restaurant.
  • Attend all informational and team building meetings to continue expanding my knowledge and skills. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

Preparation, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Possess communication skills to create a positive interactions experience with guests
  • Having basic writing, reading, math skills, as well as computer and phone proficiency
  • Previous restaurant experience is not required 

Working Conditions/Physical Demands

  • Be able to bend, reach, stoop and frequently lift to 50 pounds

  • Maintain good personal hygiene
  • Be able to effectively communicate with guests and staff with consciousness non-verbal language and cues
  • Maintain good organizational and time management skills to ensure a quick response to kitchen and guests’ needs
  • Have a positive teamwork and motivational skills

Benefits/Perks
  • Part-time positions
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Opportunity for advancement
 
Company Overview
Save A Lot is one of the nation’s leading extreme value, carefully selected assortment grocers. From Maine to California, our 1,200+ neighborhood stores serve more than 4 million shoppers each week.
We deliver our customers up to 40% savings, compared to conventional grocery stores, on exclusive Save A Lot brands and national brands, plus USDA-inspected beef, pork and poultry, farm-fresh fruits and vegetables and common household items.
Our mission is to help our customers live richer, fuller lives by saving them money and time through the great food, great prices and great people in our stores, every day.
 
Job Summary
The store clerk reports directly to the store manager and indirectly to the assistant store managers and shift leaders.  This position is responsible for duties such as cashiering, stocking, cleaning and monitoring perishables. The store clerk provides excellent customer service and assists in maintaining excellent daily store conditions.
 
Responsibilities 
  • Operates a cash register efficiently and performs checkout procedures at or above expected performance standards including, but not limited to, minimum transaction time per item rate and accurate handling/counting of cash, EBT, debit cards, credit cards, WIC vouchers, gift cards, coupons and checks 
  • Follows all check-out and cash handling procedures and policies
  • Consistently meets or exceeds set standards involving the handling, stocking, and the maintaining of grocery, frozen, dairy, smoked meat, and all perishable products
  • Stocks product on platforms, shelving, peg hooks and in baskets or refrigerated cases as needed
  • Handles power and non-powered equipment and hand tools to move stock as needed after properly trained
 
Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years of age
  • High School diploma or equivalent preferred
  • Proven, efficient retail sales experience; experience in dry grocery, perishable, meat, general grocery, cash management and excellent customer service preferred
  • Ability to regularly lift 50lbs

Benefits/Perks
  • Paid Training 
  • Part-time position
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Opportunity for advancement
 
Company Overview
Save A Lot is one of the nation’s leading extreme value, carefully selected assortment grocers. From Maine to California, our 1,200+ neighborhood stores serve more than 4 million shoppers each week.

Our mission is to help our customers live richer, fuller lives by saving them money and time through the great food, great prices and great people in our stores, every day.
 
Job Summary
The store clerk reports directly to the store manager and indirectly to the assistant store managers and shift leaders.  This position is responsible for duties such as cashiering, light stocking, cleaning and monitoring perishables. The store clerk provides excellent customer service and assists in maintaining excellent daily store conditions.
 
Responsibilities 
  • Operates a cash register efficiently and performs checkout procedures at or above expected performance standards including, but not limited to, minimum transaction time per item rate and accurate handling/counting of cash, EBT, debit cards, credit cards, WIC vouchers, gift cards, coupons and checks 
  • Follows all check-out and cash handling procedures and policies
  • Merchandising Check lane Candy

  • Cleaning

Cashier
 
We are looking for motivated Cashiers to join our team!  Cashiers must be great at managing multiple priorities and thrive in a fast-paced environment, with special attention to details while performing quality work and contributing to a friendly and productive team atmosphere.

Responsibilities:
  • Greet and inform guests of specials 
  • Check identification of guests to ensure they are of legal age to consume alcoholic beverages
  • Operate the point of sale (POS) to accept cash payment or processing credit card payment 
  • Wrap and bag product for to-go orders
  • Assist other restaurant staff as needed

Qualifications:
  • Must be 18 years or older
  • Must have or be able to obtain a CA Food Handlers Certificate before training
  • Must have or be able to obtain Alcohol Beverage Control Responsible Beverage Service Training certification  
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Able to stand for extended periods of time
  • Able to prioritize, organize, and manage multiple tasks

Complete our short application today!

Job description

Come join the MADNESS! Teriyaki Madness is one of the fastest growing fast-casual restaurant chains in the country and we’re looking for team members to join our new location in Fort Collins, CO. Our Asian inspired fast casual concept serves made to order teriyaki bowls customized with only the freshest veggies, highest quality meats and flavorful house-made sauces. Not only are these bowls delicious, but warning, they are highly addictive. We take great pride in our menu, products we serve and our expanding TEAM. Our goal is to consistently provide the highest quality food and customer service. Location individually owned and operated. Apply and see for yourself what the MADNESS is all about!

We are looking for happy, engaging and reliable cashiers who love interacting with customers. The ideal candidates should have the following qualities: Positive Attitude, Outgoing Personality, Self-Motivated, Hard Working, Friendly, Reliable, and a Good Communicator. Previous restaurant experience a PLUS!

Job Responsibilities/Skills:

  • Greets customers promptly and provides them with friendly customer service
  • Take customer orders using point of sale system
  • Outgoing personality
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Assembles customer orders to ensure quality and correctness
  • Cash handling and basic math skills a must
  • Maintains the cleanliness of the front end of the restaurant
  • Quick learner who takes direction well
  • Sets team members up for success by performing delegated side work duties
  • Handles customer concerns that do not require a manager
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Able to work for extended hours on their feet
  • Proactively ensures an amazing Customer Experience
Benefits:
  • Employee discount
  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid training
  • Tip Sharing
  • Referral program
Shift:
  • Day shift
  • Evening shift
Weekly day range:
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

jobs_name: Cashier up to $16 per hour- Sundays OFF
jobs_description:
Role Summary
Foster an environment of excellence and create Raving Fans by executing all tenets of Second Mile Service (2MS), Operational Excellence (OE) and Creating Emotional Connections (EC).
General Responsibilities
  • Read, understand and comply with all parts of the Team Member Handbook
  • Understand all tenets of Second Mile Service (2MS), Operational Excellence (OE) and Creating Emotional Connections (EC).
  • Deliver portions that are correct and meet all weight and presentation expectations.
  • Execute FIFO (First In, First Out) model is being followed.
  • Protect the customer experience by ensuring packaging, food presentation and quality is top level.
  • Appropriately handle all customer issues and play a positive role in customer recovery.
  • Show up on time, have a great attitude and work hard for your entire shift.
  • Constantly improve yourself by finding ways to do your work better and faster.
  • Proactively pursue the certification process and look for opportunities to be cross-trained.
  • Be responsible to fill your shift if you are not able work.
  • Ensure your appearance is in compliance with the Handbook
  • Be a team player
  • Display good stewardship and a sense of ownership for the business
  • Back of the House (BOH) -- Use holding and timing system and batch numbering on holding pans and in the chute system.
  • BOH -- Track waste and store according to procedure.
Requirements
  • Available to work a minimum of 35 hours per week
  • Understand the expectation of Chick-fil-A customer service standards and operational excellence.
Skills
  • Outgoing and fun
  • Great attitude
  • Hard working
  • Dependable
  • Honest
  • Demonstrate leadership attributes
  • Team-player
  • Positive attitude & role model
  • Responsive to team’s needs
  • Takes initiative
  • Works to serve others
  • Motivated to grow and to learn
  • Great verbal communicator
  • Outgoing/friendly/patient
  • Desire for ongoing training/education
  • Detailed & keenly observant
  • Passion for procedural discipline
  • Able to lift 40 - 60 pounds on a consistent basis

About our Company

We are seeking a dynamic Coffee Shop Cashier to join our team.  A successful candidate will have a genuine passion for the hospitality industry and an entrepreneurial spirit.
Responsibilities
  1. Greet every guest promptly with a smile and maintain eye contact
  2. Must be courteous and gracious, maintaining a professional demeanor at all times
  3. Establish and maintain good communications and team work with fellow colleagues and other departments within the hotel
  4. Offer guests an enjoyable experience that conforms to the hotel’s standards of excellence, professionalism and friendliness
  5. Demonstrate advanced understanding and knowledge of the sequence of service, following this sequence for every guest
  6. Possess expert knowledge of the POS system to correctly and strategically communicate guest orders
  7. Possess knowledge of coffee shop products and be able to effectively communicate details of menu items
  8. Responsible for receiving payment for all items ordered, correct cash handling and gratuity distribution
  9. Take ownership of all service issues brought to your attention by guests
  10. Maintain an increased awareness of safety issues throughout the hotel
  11. Participate in scheduled departmental and administrative meetings as requested
  12. Adhere to all standards of operations, policies and procedures, manuals, memos and verbal instructions
  13. Be familiar with all safety and emergency procedures including OSHA requirements
Core Competencies
  1. High School diploma or general education degree (GED)
  2. Three (3) years related experience in hospitality or service industry preferred
  3. Strong communication skills
  4. Collaborative spirit
  5. Ethical Conduct
  6. Computer Proficiency: Microsoft Office, Opera PMS   
  7. Positive Attitude
  8. Eye for Detail
  9. Problem solving abilities
Compensation & Benefits
We offer competitive wages and benefits while fostering a diverse and inclusive work experience.  
We thrive in being a diverse work environment. Consideration for employment will be based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic as established by law.

jobs_name: Cooks Cashiers and Order Takers NEEDED
jobs_description:
PART-TIME AND FULL-TIME POSITIONS AVAILABLE

***We pay Full-Time Crew Members $15.00+ based on experience***  
Full time employment is an average of 30 hours a week.
We are looking for people with positive engaging personalities that smile through a head set, speak clearly and show genuine care for the guest experience.  

Cashier/Order Taker Responsibilities include but not limited to:
  • A friendly smile
  • Ability to serve our guests needs with a high sense of urgency
  • Enjoy working as part of a team
  • Must have a food handler’s permit
  • Previous experience working with a Point of Sale (POS) system is a plus, but not required.
  • Open to varied work schedules and hours depending on restaurant’s needs
  • Must be able to use to lift, push, pull, or carry heavy objects up to 40 pounds
  • Must be able to stand for several hours and walk for long periods of time
  • Must be able to bend, stretch, twist, or reach for objects on shelves at various height levels
Cook Responsibilities / But not limited to
  • Ability to serve our guests needs with a high sense of urgency
  • Enjoy working as part of a team
  • Must have a food handler’s permit
  • Open to varied work schedules and hours depending on restaurant’s needs
  • Must be able to use to lift, push, pull, or carry heavy objects up to 40 pounds
  • Must be able to stand for several hours and walk for long periods of time
  • Must be able to bend, stretch, twist, or reach for objects on shelves at various height levels
Qualifications:
  • Must be able to multitask
  • Must have a food handler’s permit
  • Be able to lift 40 pounds
  • Have a "yes" to the guest and each other mentality
  • Need to have stamina to maintain good energy over the shift
Everything we do is rooted in respect for our employees.
P. Terry's believes that the crewmembers are the backbone and foundation of our success. With that in mind we made the industry leading decision to pay our full-time crew members a $15.00 minimum wage after their first 90 days of full-time employment.
 
Community Involvement
Our reputation for giving does not stop with our employees; P. Terry's has given more than $1 million dollars back to local charities since its inception in 2005.

  • A friendly smile
  • Ability to serve our guests needs with a high sense of urgency
  • Enjoy working as part of a team
  • Must have a food handler’s permit
  • Previous experience working with a Point of Sale (POS) system is a plus, but not required.
  • Open to varied work schedules and hours depending on restaurant’s needs
  • Must be able to use to lift, push, pull, or carry heavy objects up to 40 pounds
  • Must be able to stand for several hours and walk for long periods of time
  • Must be able to bend, stretch, twist, or reach for objects on shelves at various height levels
Cook Responsibilities / But not limited to
  • Ability to serve our guests needs with a high sense of urgency
  • Enjoy working as part of a team
  • Must have a food handler’s permit

PART-TIME AND FULL-TIME POSITIONS AVAILABLE in ALL our South Austin Locations. Once you apply, please let us know which location you prefer, or if you are willing to work at any location.
Our South Austin locations are:
  • COMING SOON; Our new location at Slaughter and HWY 35
  • Oltorf
  • Ben White and S. Congress
  • William Cannon and MOPAC
As a cook with P. Terry"s  you will be responsible for preparing and cooking our food’s high quality ingredients. 
We are looking for someone with a make it right mentality, and the ability to work positively with a team in a high paced environment.
Responsibilities:
  • Prepare and cook high quality ingredients
  • Read tickets and deliver a high quality product that meets our time goals
  • Service oriented with the team and guest
Qualifications:
  • Must have a food handler’s permit
  • Be able to stand up for 8-10 hours
  • Be able to lift 50 pounds
About Us: 
We started P. Terry’s with the understanding that treating our employees fairly would be the basis for our success. We pay better than most, we allow for everyone’s voice to be heard, and we maintain a learning-oriented, team-based culture that’s free of silly internal politics.
We pay better than most, with quick raises for great performance and positive attitudes. We offer unique benefits - a Christmas bonus for every employee, interest-free loans, a cake on your birthday, and more. Most importantly, we offer advancement and educational opportunities at every level of our business, so that our employees can succeed with us and in their careers beyond.

We are looking for Counter & Cashiers to join the NYPD team! You will be helping to create exceptional experiences for our customers during their experience with us by taking and serving food and drink orders and resolving customer issues. 
 
We are looking for people who are passionate about food and dining and share that passion by going above and beyond for customers. A natural people person who wants to work in a fun environment and join a team that feels like family. 
 
Responsibilities: 
  • Take orders from customers for food and beverages
  • Maintain a working knowledge of food and drink menu items, promotions, ingredients, and prep time
  • Communicate customer orders to kitchen staff via POS system
  • Collect customer payments and provide change in a timely and courteous manner
Qualifications: 
  • Previous restaurant experience preferred 
  • Ability to stand, walk, and carry food trays for prolonged periods of time
  • Ability to effectively listen to and respond to customer needs
  • Must have a courteous, friendly and professional demeanor
  • Ability to multitask efficiently
 
Complete our short application today!

La Rosa Chicken & Grill
Brand new franchise looking for a counter/cashier. Fast paced and with excellent working conditions. We are Covid conscious and maintain a clean working environment for employees and patrons. Candidate must be reliable, people friendly, a multi-tasker, willing to work at a fast pace, and be a team player. Prior work experience is not necessary but is a plus. We are willing to train. We have both full time and part time poisitions available. There is an opportunity for career advancement. All candidates must be willing to do a background check.

Job Purpose: Responsible for accurately ringing up foods and beverages in compliance with cashier policies and procedures. Responsible for preparing, portioning, packaging, and serving all menu items to customer.

Job Tasks and Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
1. Able to perform and execute duties and responsibilities of counter service/cashier position
2. Provides prompt, courteous customer service
3. Prepares, portions, and packages all menu items
4. Operates cash register according to cashier policies and procedures
5. Knows, suggestively sells, provides information and complimentary samples of Eatery products to customers
6. Maintains proper food handling, safety, and sanitation standards
7. Performs open & closing checklists in Eatery stations
8. Maintains cleanliness and appearance of station and equipment
9. Adheres to all company safety regulations and work rules
10. Accepts instruction from Department Lead person
11. Performs all department and community open/close activities
12. Performs all other tasks as assigned

Benefits / Compensation
• Closed six major holidays each year
• Paid Time Off
• Medical Insurance (upon qualifications)
• 401(k) (upon qualifications)
• Free Meals
