SKIP THE INTERVIEW - YOU WILL BE CONTACTED IMMEDIATELY FOR A PAID 2 HOUR TRIAL SHIFT SO YOU CAN EXPERIENCE OUR AMAZING WORK ENVIRONMENT - IS A FUN PLACE TO WORK, WE BAKE AND SELL CAKES :)
 
COME HAVE SOME CAKE WITH US    -    FLEXIBLE WORK SCHEDULE, BUT NO WEEKDAY SHIFTS START AFTER 2PM, NO WEEKEND ONLY POSITIONS AVAILABLE
 
 BE HOME FOR DINNER OR WITH FRIENDS OR FAMILY

The Nothing Bundt Cakes (NbC) Guest Service Representative creates a warm, welcoming environment for our guests, offers creative solutions for unique celebratory occasions and sells our delicious cakes. 

Accountabilities/Duties: 

  • Promptly greets walk-in and phone guests with genuine warmth and helpful enthusiasm to determine interests and needs, and follows NbC Sweet Steps of Service to create a superior guest experience.   
  • Maintains strong product knowledge to educate guests on NbC cake distinction, size and flavor profile options, pricing, special promotions, and complimentary retail merchandise.   
  • Suggests additional merchandise, including balloons, candles, and cards, to complete a unique celebration. 
 
Core Values and Competencies:
  • Goes above and beyond to support the team or guest, and is reliable, trustworthy and responsive. 
  • Demonstrates pride in responsibilities, an intense drive and a passion to succeed. 
  • Takes initiative and 100% ownership of responsibilities, with zero excuses for issues within direct control.  
  • Operates with a strong sense of urgency and adheres to NbC brand standards.
  • Projects warmth, enthusiasm, and optimism that attracts others. 
 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Exhibits high energy and strong interpersonal skills; is friendly, helpful, positive, patient, socially confident and communicative. 
  • Enjoys interacting with diverse people and excels at providing a superior guest experience.  
  • Can perform multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining meticulous attention to detail. 
 
Education, Certifications and Work Experience Requirements:

  • Applicants must be 16 years of age or older and approved to work in the United States.
  • While no formal education or work experience is required, previous guest service experience at a bakery, restaurant or retail store is a plus.  
 
Work Availability: 

Must have the flexibility to work various shifts, including early mornings, evenings, weekends and holidays availability is Mandatory, based on changing business demands. 

Experience at McDonald's, Starbucks, Trader Joe's, Chic-Fil-A, and other fast food concepts is helpful.

The Nothing Bundt Cakes (NbC) Guest Service Representative creates a warm, welcoming environment for our guests, offers creative solutions for unique celebratory occasions and sells our delicious cakes. 

Accountabilities/Duties: 

  • Promptly greets walk-in and phone guests with genuine warmth and helpful enthusiasm to determine interests and needs, and follows NbC Sweet Steps of Service to create a superior guest experience.   
  • Maintains strong product knowledge to educate guests on NbC cake distinction, size and flavor profile options, pricing, special promotions, and complimentary retail merchandise.   
  • Suggests additional merchandise, including balloons, candles, and cards, to complete a unique celebration. 
 
Core Values and Competencies:
  • Goes above and beyond to support the team or guest, and is reliable, trustworthy and responsive. 
  • Demonstrates pride in responsibilities, an intense drive and a passion to succeed. 
  • Takes initiative and 100% ownership of responsibilities, with zero excuses for issues within direct control.  
  • Operates with a strong sense of urgency and adheres to NbC brand standards.
  • Projects warmth, enthusiasm, and optimism that attracts others. 
 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Exhibits high energy and strong interpersonal skills; is friendly, helpful, positive, patient, socially confident and communicative. 
  • Enjoys interacting with diverse people and excels at providing a superior guest experience.  
  • Can perform multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining meticulous attention to detail. 
 
Education, Certifications and Work Experience Requirements:

  • Applicants must be 16 years of age or older and approved to work in the United States.
  • While no formal education or work experience is required, previous guest service experience at a bakery, restaurant or retail store is a plus.  
 
Work Availability: 

Must have the flexibility to work various shifts, including early mornings, evenings, weekends and holidays availability is Mandatory, based on changing business demands.

POSITION TITLE:                  Customer Service (Cashier)
LOCATION:                             Zephyrhills Thrift Shoppe
DEPARTMENT:                      thrift Shoppe Operations
SHIFT:                                     Day Shift
REPORTS TO:                       Thrift Shoppe & Volunteer Manager



POSITION SUMMARY:
Reporting to the Thrift Shoppe & Volunteer Manager, the Thrift Shoppe Cashier is responsible for providing customer service to thrift shoppe customers, providing accurate cashier services, and ensuring a positive shopping experience.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS:
  • High School Diploma/GED required
  • Minimum of 1 year cashier experience required
  • Experience in a thrift or consignment shop preferred
ESSSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
·        Provide cashier service to customers by utilizing a cash register, POS and/or credit card terminal.
·        Welcome and engage with customers as they enter the shoppe and respond to customer questions.
·        Provide excellent interaction and customer service to customers, co-workers, and volunteers both in shoppe and over the phone.
·        Straighten and restock the shoppe throughout the day, before opening and after closing.
·        Ensure returns and /or go-backs are returned to their proper department at end of shift.
·        Assist in other areas of thrift shoppe when necessary including at other thrift shoppe locations.

·        This position will occasionally require working during non-operating store hours and holidays, which may include restocking days and promotional evening and weekend events.

The Nothing Bundt Cakes (NbC) Customer Service Representative creates a warm, welcoming environment for our guests, offers creative solutions for unique celebratory occasions and sells our delicious cakes. The Guest Service Representative is the first point of brand contact in our bakery and serves in an essential role to engage and bring joy to our guests, create a memorable experience and leave a positive, lasting impression. The Guest Service Representative embodies NbC core values and demonstrates a strong commitment to guest satisfaction as well as excellence and efficiency in the workplace.
 
Accountabilities/Duties: 
  • Promptly greets walk-in and phone guests with genuine warmth and helpful enthusiasm to determine interests and needs, and follows NbC Sweet Steps of Service to create a superior guest experience.   
  • Maintains strong product knowledge to educate guests on NbC cake distinction, size and flavor profile options, pricing, special promotions, and complimentary retail merchandise.   
  • Suggests additional merchandise, including balloons, candles, and cards, to complete a unique celebration. 
  • Processes guest orders efficiently and accurately utilizing the point-of-sale system and invite guests to join NbC Email Club to benefit from special promotions and remain connected. 
  • Upholds a clean and organized bakery presentation, which may include routine sweeping/mopping of the floor, and dusting/cleaning of countertops, windows, and other surfaces. 
  • Replenishes retail merchandise and cake display case to ensure a strong visual presentation. 
  • Assists the Crafter in preparing cake decorations and packaging supplies as needed. 
  • Complies with all health and safety guidelines and NbC policies and procedures, including strict adherence to dress code and personal hygiene.  
  • Maintains a consistent work attendance and punctuality record.  
 
Core Values and Competencies: 
  • Servant’s Heart
    • Goes above and beyond to support the team or guest, and is reliable, trustworthy and responsive. 
    • Keeps the good of the team or guest ahead of personal interests or gain. 
    • Displays humility and empathy in interactions with others.
  • Spirit of a Champion 
    • Demonstrates pride in responsibilities, an intense drive and a passion to succeed. 
    • Takes initiative and 100% ownership of responsibilities, with zero excuses for issues within direct control.  
    • Operates with a strong sense of urgency and adheres to NbC brand standards.
  • Genuine Connections 
    • Projects warmth, enthusiasm, and optimism that attracts others. 
    • Builds positive, productive relationships with all team members. 
    • Listens actively and communicates openly, clearly and respectfully. 
 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
  • Exhibits high energy and strong interpersonal skills; is friendly, helpful, positive, patient, socially confident and communicative. 
  • Enjoys interacting with diverse people and excels at providing a superior guest experience.  
  • Can perform multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining meticulous attention to detail. 
  • Is diligent, organized and self-motivated.  
  • Has the ability to understand and carry out oral and written instructions and request clarification when needed.
  • Is comfortable with new technology and has the ability to operate a point-of-sale system. 
  • Understands basic arithmetic; can perform calculations when needed and provide monetary change using U.S. currency. 
  • Has the capacity to stand for extended periods of time and work in a fast-paced environment. 
 
Education, Certifications and Work Experience Requirements:
  • Applicants must be 16 years of age or older. 
  • While no formal education or work experience is required, previous guest service experience at a bakery, restaurant or retail store is a plus.  
 
Work Availability: 
Must have the flexibility to work various shifts, including early mornings, evenings, weekends and holidays, based on changing business demands. We can work around specific schedules for both part time and full time positions.

Vendors' Village is awesome, and we mean it! To back that up, we packed hundreds of vendors selling everything from fun vintage finds to hand crafted home décor all under one roof. Vendors' Village is not just shopping; it is an experience. Our stores are quilted together with the true expression of our wonderful vendors. Since opening our first store in 2010, we have continued to expand to four area locations in Kentucky and Indiana. Whether it be as a customer, vendor, or an employee, we would like to thank you for being part of the Vendors' Village family.

Our ideal candidate is outgoing, friendly, ambitious, and hard-working.

Job Perks
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Unique and fun work environment
  • Retirement benefits
  • No early mornings or late nights
  • Stress free work environment
  • No semi unloading or heavy lifting
  • Great job for college students and retired people
  • Access to free arcade on your breaks :D
Responsibilities are but not limited to:
  • Greet customers and make them feel at home
  • Answer any questions the customers or vendors may have
  • Assisting vendors with instore accounts
  • Cash handling
  • Clean work area as needed to maintain a tidy work environment

Qualifications: 
  • Friendly attitude to all customers, vendors and co-workers
  • Responsible and proven ability to maintain scheduling commitments
  • Responsible and proven ability to handle cash accurately
  • Must be able to type/keyboard 20 wpm
  • Good communication skills with our customers, vendors, and staff
  • Must be able to stand for long period of time 
  • Have reliable transportation
Thank You!

Golden Corral of Rocky Mount is currently seeking energetic, friendly individuals to join our team!   
Entering and leaving Golden Corral are two of the most critical moments in the guest’s experience because lasting impressions are formed during these moments.  The Cashier / Host’s interactions with our guests and these impressions ultimately dictate whether the guest will return.

Job Responsibilities:
  • Greets guests as they enter the restaurant and offers a sincere, personal invitation to return as the guests leave.
  • Offers assistance to any guests who may need help.
  • Friendly and courteous on the phone.
  • Handles payments accurately.
  • Knows what is on buffet for the day and has a full knowledge of menu and prices.
  • Maintains organization and cleanliness at the vestibule, host/cashier station and surrounding areas.

Dietary Cashier Counter Attendant 
 
SUMMARY
 
This position is responsible for Collection of payment for all Cafeteria sales. 
Reports to Dietary Manager
Classification: Non-Exempt
           
 
QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum six months cashier and customer service experience required, preferably in food service industry.  High school diploma or GED desired. 
                                                  
OCCUPATIONAL EXPOSURE
Category III exposure.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
  1. Responsible for the collection of payment for all tabulated food tickets and items sold at the Cashier’s Counter.  Cashier will be accountable for a balanced drawer throughout their shift.
  2. Follow all company guidelines for accounting and cash handling procedures.
  3. Responsible for proper handling of guest comments and complaints.
  4. Responsible for preparing daily deposits and change order requests.
  5. Responsible for the general organization and cleanliness of the Cashiers booth.
  6. Assist management in any way that is conductive to the efficient operation of the facility.
  7. Food and Beverage Service
  8. Must be knowledgeable in all menu and price offerings as well as point of purchase marketing materials.
  9. Must be knowledgeable of all serving utensils and displays along with the correct application.
  10. Proficient in serving all foods and beverages displayed on the serving line. Serves guests prepared items.
  11. Helps maintain adequate dishes, glasses, trays, and silverware on counter.
  12. Monitors and maintains adequate line movement.
  13. Assists other team members when necessary, including announcements and phone management. 
  14. Maintains organization throughout the shift in work areas.
  15. Stores all items in their designated labeled areas and eliminates clutter.
  16. Follows standardized cleaning procedures and practices the “clean-as-you-go” philosophy.
  17. Responsible for following all food safety and sanitation throughout the shift.
  18. Follows departmental opening and closing procedures.
  19. Performs daily cleaning assignment(s).
  20. Adheres to Facility’s Emergency Preparedness Program, Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and other mandatory programs in the Facility as appropriate.
  21. Effectively communicates product, equipment, or operational issues to management in a timely manner.
  22. Responsible for reviewing schedule and checking out with management before leaving.
  23. Comply with facility Standards of Behavior and complete all required education assignments within the designated timeline.
 
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
  1. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  2. While performing the duties of this job the employee must be capable of prolonged standing and walking on a continuous basis, converse, and listen; use hands to touch, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; and to reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.
  3. The employee must be able to lift and/or carry up to 20 pounds on a regular basis.
 
WORK ENVIRONMENT
  1. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

POSITION: Events Cashier 

REPORTS TO: Events and Operations Supervisor  

Position summary: the TRACK at new balance is a state-of-the-art multi-sport and multi-function facility. The goal of an Events Cashier is to oversee the operation of the snack bar and merchandise shop. This position is part time and scheduled based on facility needs.

Position Responsibilities: 
  • Assist guests in purchasing food, beverages, and merchandise 
  • Provide excellent customer service 
  • Handle cash and card payments 
  • Count inventory and alert management of low stock 
  • Maintain a clean area for sales 
Required Skills/Abilities: 
  • Functions well in quick paced environments 
  • Quickly identify challenges and relevant solutions 
  • Ability to balance multiple tasks in an efficient manner 
  • Maintains flexibility with scheduling and work hours 
  • Must be able to work nights and weekends 
Education/Experience: 
  • High School Degree 
  • Relevant cash handling experience.

REPORTS TO: General Manager/Assistant Manager/Shift Leader 
 
The cashier position is critical to the daily success of the restaurant. It’s a guest facing job; often the first touch point with the guest beyond the “Welcome to Firehouse” greeting. 
 
Job Requirements: 
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent menu and product knowledge.
  • Accountable for the accuracy of the guest’s order.
  • Able to communicate effectively with guests and handle questions and concerns in a professional manner.
  • Proficient use of the POS system.
  • Accuracy of the cash drawer.
  • Team player.
  • Thanks the guest sincerely for their business.
  • Participates in all Firehouse Subs® Public Safety Foundation fundraising initiatives.
  • Maintains an organized, stocked, and sanitary work space.
  • Able and willing to complete other restaurant functions such as food preparation or cleaning, per management direction, or any other duties assigned by the general manager, assistant manager, or shift leader.
  • Maintains a safe work environment, adhering to all established food and safety guidelines.
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs.
Benefits: 
  • Hourly Pay
  • Paid time off
  • Flexible hours
  • Growth potential/Opportunity for advancement within my agency

JOB DESCRIPTION
The FOH Server/Cashier may work in the capacity of Cashier, Expeditor, and/or Greeter. The FOH Server/ 
Cashier maintains consistent customer service focus always showing pride of ownership and a sense of urgency to 
delight the Guest. Enthusiastically greets Guests with a warm, genuine welcome. Consistently follows high standards of 
service.
• Demonstrates strong comprehension of menu including recipes, allergens, and dietary restriction 
workarounds.
• Processes Guest orders in person or by telephone using the POS, handle cash and credit/debit card 
transactions with accuracy while upholding register dialogue.
• Follows all cash handling procedures, including fraud protection, and properly assigns and checks out 
drawers as required.
• Presents food to Guests, circulates dining room for service opportunities, pre-busses, and busses tables, 
and greets Guests who are walking into the restaurant, standing in line, or exiting the restaurant.
• Maintains clean floors, busses, and washes dishes, cleans and restocks bathrooms, wipes windows. 
Maintains the overall cleanliness of the restaurant.
• Processes Guest orders at the register, simultaneously pour beverages, answers questions about our 
menu, and keep the front counter area clean and organized.
• Restock the ice bin, dry clean tumblers, and glassware.
• Communicates regularly and consistently with Guests and employees working in other stations (BOH and 
FOH) to optimize service levels.
• Other tasks as assigned.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
FOH Server/Cashier must exercise the following qualities and skills:
• Strong customer service personality and skills
• Prior experience in a customer service or restaurant environment preferred.
• Ability to remain calm under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
• Reliable transportation and ability to arrive at work on time and maintain a positive attendance record.
• Ability to remain calm under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
• Reliable transportation and ability to arrive at work on time and maintain a positive attendance record.
• Ability to work a flexible schedule, including weekends, holidays, and evenings.
• Good communication, organization, and interpersonal skills to establish and maintain effective working 
relationships with co-workers.
• Current Food Handlers Card or ServSafe Certificate.
PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE
• A minimum of 6 months experience as a Cashier in a hospitality or retail environment. Previous restaurant 
experience is preferred.

HUALAPAI PREFERENCE
 
Position:                      Food & Beverage Cashier - GCW 
Department:                Grand Canyon West
Classification:             Non-Exempt
Salary Range:              H4
Supervisor:                  Food & Beverage Supervisor
 
Disclaimer: Position Description is not meant to encompass all aspects of position, other duties may be assigned.
 
Position Summary:
Food & Beverage Cashiers are responsible for utilizing the POS system to handle Food & Beverage transactions, both cash and credit and answering questions from quests concerning Grand Canyon West locations and operations. Provides outstanding customer service at all times. May assist with food handling duties, if needed.
 
Knowledge and Abilities:
  1. Ability to communicate well and interact with guests in a clear concise manner.
  2. Ability to provide outstanding customer service by providing prompt, courteous and helpful information to guests.
  3. Experience in use of POS systems and handling cash and credit transactions while following proper cash handling policies and procedures.
  4. Ability to reconcile cash drawer and end of day sales reports.
  5. Ability to work in a team environment, multi-task efficiently and maintain positive working relationships.
  6. Knowledge of Grand Canyon West locations, operations, Hualapai history and culture.
 
Duties & Responsibilities:
  1. Handle cash and credit retail transactions using the POS system.
  2. Responsible for assigned cash drawer and end of day balancing of cash and sales reports.
  3. Handle all transactions using proper cash control policies and procedures.
  4. Assist guests with questions they have concerning Grand Canyon West locations, operations, Hualapai history and culture. Provide outstanding customer service using high service standards.
  5. Assist with maintaining inventory and assist in stock inventory, as directed.
  6. May assist with basic food handling and custodial duties, as needed.
  7. Perform other work-related duties as assigned.
 
 
Qualifications:
  1. Good oral communication skills.
  2. Valid Driver’s License with clean driving record preferred.
  3. High School Diploma or GED.
  4. Ability to lift up to 25 pounds.
  5. Prior experience working with a POS system or cash handling preferred.
  6. Food Handlers’ card preferred.
  7. Preference given to Hualapai Tribal members.
 
Working Conditions:
Typical café/deli environment with high transaction volume. May be required to lift up to 25 lbs. Must be able to work varying schedules, weekends and holidays. Willingness to work in remote location.
 
 
 
 
Applicant must pass a pre-employment drug screen and extensive background check may be required. All applicants are considered without regard to age, sex, race, national origin, religion, marital status or physical disability. However, preference may be given to persons of Indian decent in accordance with Public law 88-353, Section 703 (7-2-71) and Public Law 93-638, Section 7B

FT or PT, Mon-Sun, Flexible schedule, Hours 8:30am - 9:30pm, Food Discount. College Students, High School Students and Retirees Welcome.

REPORTS TO: General Manager/Assistant Manager/Shift Leader
 
Position Summary Statement: The line positions are critical to the daily success of the restaurant. Part of our mission is to serve hearty and flavorful food, and it has to be done right! The line is just that…the front lines of our operation and standards must be exceeded to ensure we execute on our mission.
 
Job Requirements:
 
  • Food prep, restaurant duties, and cashier.Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent menu and product knowledge.
  • Accountable for the preparation of the guest’s order.
  • Able to communicate effectively with guests and handle questions and concerns in a professional manner.
  • Team player.
  • Thanks the guest sincerely for their business.
  • Participates in all Firehouse Subs® Public Safety Foundation fundraising initiatives.
  • Maintains an organized, stocked, and sanitary work space.
  • Able and willing to complete other restaurant functions such as cashier or cleaning, per management direction, or any other duties assigned by the general manager, assistant manager, or shift leader.
  • Maintains a safe work environment, adhering to all established food and safety guidelines.
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs.

Job Title: Cashier 

Reports to: GM 

Summary: Greets customers with a smile,, efficient operation of the restaurant and keeps the area around the cash register as clean and orderly as possible by performing the following duties. 
Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. 

▪ Receive payments and present change to customers. 
▪ Pack food items ensuring that every order is complete. 
▪ Function as the host/hostess of the Food Truck when needed. 
▪ Appeal to impatient or irritated customers, especially during rush hours ▪ Manage the register, including all credit card and cash operations. ▪ Ensure a balance of the register at the end of the shift or working period. 

Requirements – Qualities – Knowledge, Skills and Abilities – for the  Restaurant Cashier Position 

A qualified candidate for the position of a restaurant cashier must have outstanding  interactive and communication skills and also possess the enthusiasm to work with  other staff as a team player. 

He/she should be able to carry up to 25 pounds and work in standing positions for up to  eight hours per period. 

This position will also entail pulling, stretching, pushing, and incessant use of the wrist  and fingers. 

In addition to these, the following qualities, skills, knowledge, and abilities are most  sought after by employers: 

▪ High school diploma coupled with experience in related positions, as well as  working knowledge in a similar role 
▪ Excellent mathematical, multitasking, and computer skills 
▪ Proficiency in using computers, calculator, and other machines required for  transactions. 
▪ Outstanding customer relation skills and ability to ensure a customer priority  culture.

▪ I AGREE TO PERFORM THE ABOVE RESPONSIBILITIES AND TO FOLLOW ALL COMPANY POLICIES:

FRONT COUNTER CASHIER - Full-Time or Part-Time
Available to work at any Colder's store location as needed (West Allis, Oak Creek, Delafield, Grafton)
five days scheduled over a seven day week - No Late Nights!
approximate schedule: Mon-Fri 10:30am - 7:00pm, Saturday 9:30am-6:00pm, Sunday, 10:30am-5:00pm

ESSENTIAL TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • In-person customer service
  • Process and post customer payments including finance applications
  • Office administrative functions including but not limited to; typing, filing, scanning, copying, answering phone
  • Call customers to schedule delivery and pick up 
  • Light data entry and inventory management
  • Work and communicate with a team as well as independently
  • Multi-task and prioritize while maintaining exceptional accuracy
  • Perform miscellaneous tasks as assigned by supervisor or management
 QUALIFICATIONS: 
  • High School diploma required
  • Excellent communication skills  
  • Basic typing and office administrative skills
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Available to work daytime, holiday, and evening hours including weekends
    (No late nights! Our stores close early evening at 7pm Mon-Fri, 6pm on Sat and 5pm on Sun.)
ABOUT YOU:
  • Great attitude and willing to learn
  • Exceptionally organized, detail oriented
  • Work well in a busy, change by the minute environment
  • Dependable
  • Team Player 
BENEFITS:
We are proud to offer a competitive wage along with great benefits to our employees!

  • Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance (full-time)
  • 401(k) Retirement (plan rules apply)
  • Exceptional Employee Discount Program
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Family-owned company with opportunity to grow and advance

Are you…?
  • Driven 🏎💨
  • A team player ⚽️
  • Enthusiastic 🤩
  • Fun-Loving 🥳
  • Reliable 📅
We are looking to add positive, hard working individuals to our ever-evolving team at Launch Entertainment Park. 

As an employee, you’ll be treated like family. Our managers truly care and go out of their way to ensure your longevity, success, and happiness because when you succeed so do we!

Do you appreciate teamwork, respect, accountability, and integrity? Our team thrives on these principles. 

Your mission, should you choose to apply, is to join with us in creating an Atmosphere of Optimism for thousands of Families. We are looking for people just like you who embody our core values: LIMITLESS PEOPLE operating with LOVE & PASSION and FUN ENERGY!!"
You will be a driving force behind the heartbeat of Launch, generating excitement and fun everywhere you go, all while providing the ultimate customer service experience. 
Part & Full Time Positions Available

MUST BE ABLE TO WORK WEEKENDS, VACATIONS and HOLIDAYS!

Qualifications:

  • Must be able to communicate clearly with supervisors, managers, colleagues and especially with customers.
  • Be able to reach, bend, stoop and frequently lift up to 25 pounds.
  • Be able to work in a standing position for long periods of time (up to 10 hours)

Think you’re what we’re looking for?

Send us your resume, and, if you really want to stand out from the crowd, also attach a short bio or link to yourself on video and answer the following questions:

  • Why do you think you’re a good fit for Launch?
  • What is your background in customer service? OR Tell us about a time you received exceptional customer service.
  • What are some of your achievements, interests, hobbies, skills, or talents?

We are very excited to build our team at Nothing Bundt Cakes Carle Place and are looking for an outgoing and friendly individual to assist our guests with their orders.  As the cashier/guest service representative you will create a warm and welcoming environment in which to serve our guests both in person and by the phone.  Duties include side work for the crafting department, some light cleaning and clerical duties. This is a fun place to work and grow! Flexible work schedules, comfy and casual attire, and cake discounts! Come be a part of our team! Help us bring joy to the community!
You will be trained in all the responsibilities of the position.   Morning and early afternoon shifts during the week and some Saturdays.  Hours of operation M-F 9-6pm, Sat 10-6pm, closed Sundays.
Requirements:
Possess a strong sense of teamwork.
Ability to follow instructions.
Has integrity.
Works well under pressure.
Attention to detail.
Multi-tasking ability.
Strong sales ability.
Genuine care for others’ needs.
Nothing Bundt Cakes Core Values
A Servant’s Heart, goes above and beyond to support the team or guest, is reliable, trustworthy and responsive
A Spirit of a Champion, demonstrates pride in responsibilities, an intense drive and passion to succeed

jobs_name: Front of the House Team Member: Server, Cashier
jobs_description:
Golden Corral Bensalem the "best kept secret in the hospitality industry" is now in season with new and exciting opportunities. We are currently seeking enthusiastic/high energy individuals with a passion for customer service.  

Server: Sever Rate + Tipped Wage, Fast Paced, High Volume Environment, Customer Service Driven

Cashier, Host, Hostess, Bartender – Responsible for ring up customers, Seating Customers, Making Drinks,

Benefits/Perks
  • Part-time positions
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Opportunity for advancement
Company Overview
Save A Lot is one of the nation’s leading extreme value, carefully selected assortment grocers. From Maine to California, our 1,200+ neighborhood stores serve more than 4 million shoppers each week.
We deliver our customers up to 40% savings, compared to conventional grocery stores, on exclusive Save A Lot brands and national brands, plus USDA-inspected beef, pork and poultry, farm-fresh fruits and vegetables and common household items.
Our mission is to help our customers live richer, fuller lives by saving them money and time through the great food, great prices and great people in our stores every day.
Peebles Save-A-Lot is a family-owned and operated business with strong ties to the community. 
 
Job Summary
The Grocery Store Clerk reports directly to the store manager and indirectly to the assistant store managers and shift leaders.  This position is responsible for duties such as cashiering, stocking, cleaning, and monitoring perishables. The store clerk provides excellent customer service and assists in maintaining excellent daily store conditions.
 
Responsibilities 
  • Operates a cash register efficiently and performs checkout procedures at or above expected performance standards, including, but not limited to, minimum transaction time per item rate and accurate handling/counting of cash, EBT, debit cards, credit cards, gift cards, and checks 
  • Follows all check-out and cash handling procedures and policies
  • Consistently meets or exceeds set standards involving the handling, stocking, and the maintaining of grocery, frozen, dairy, smoked meat, and all perishable products
  • Stocks product on platforms, shelving, peg hooks and in baskets or refrigerated cases as needed
  • Handles power and non-powered equipment and hand tools to move stock as needed after properly trained

Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years of age
  • A High School diploma or equivalent preferred
  • Proven, efficient retail sales experience; experience in dry grocery, perishable, meat, general grocery, cash management, and excellent customer service preferred
  • Ability to regularly lift 50lbs
  • Must be available to work evenings, weekends, and holidays

The Nothing Bundt Cakes (NbC) Guest Service Representative/Cashier creates a warm, welcoming environment for our guests(customers), offers creative solutions for all occasions and sells our delicious cakes. The Guest Service Representative/Cashier is the first point of brand contact in our bakery and serves in an essential role to engage and bring joy to our guests, create a memorable experience and leave a positive, lasting impression. The Guest Service Representative/Cashier embodies our core values listed below and demonstrates a strong commitment to guest(customer) satisfaction as well as excellence and efficiency in the workplace.
 
Accountabilities/Duties: 
  • Promptly greets walk-in and phone guests with genuine warmth and helpful enthusiasm to determine interests and needs, and follows NbC Sweet Steps of Service to create a superior guest experience.   
  • Maintains strong product knowledge to educate guests on NbC cake distinction, size and flavor profile options, pricing, special promotions, and complimentary retail merchandise.   
  • Suggests additional merchandise, including balloons, candles, and cards, to complete a unique celebration. 
  • Processes guest orders efficiently and accurately utilizing the point-of-sale system and invite guests to join NbC Email Club to benefit from special promotions and remain connected. 
  • Upholds a clean and organized bakery presentation, which may include routine sweeping/mopping of the floor, and dusting/cleaning of countertops, windows, and other surfaces. 
  • Replenishes retail merchandise and cake display case to ensure a strong visual presentation. 
  • Assists the Crafter in preparing cake decorations and packaging supplies as needed. 
  • Complies with all health and safety guidelines and NbC policies and procedures, including strict adherence to dress code and personal hygiene.  
  • Maintains a consistent work attendance and punctuality record.  
 
Core Values and Competencies: 
  • Servant’s Heart
    • Goes above and beyond to support the team or guest, and is reliable, trustworthy and responsive. 
    • Keeps the good of the team or guest ahead of personal interests or gain. 
  • Spirit of a Champion 
    • Demonstrates pride in responsibilities, an intense drive and a passion to succeed. 
    • Takes initiative and 100% ownership of responsibilities, with zero excuses for issues within direct control.  
  • Genuine Connections 
    • Builds positive, productive relationships with all team members. 
    • Listens actively and communicates openly, clearly and respectfully. 
 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
  • Exhibits high energy and strong interpersonal skills; is friendly, helpful, positive, patient, socially confident and communicative. 
  • Enjoys interacting with diverse people and excels at providing a superior guest experience.  
  • Can perform multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining meticulous attention to detail. 
  • Is diligent, organized and self-motivated.  
  • Has the ability to understand and carry out oral and written instructions and request clarification when needed.
  • Is comfortable with new technology and has the ability to operate a point-of-sale system. 
  • Understands basic arithmetic; can perform calculations when needed and provide monetary change using U.S. currency. 
  • Has the capacity to stand for extended periods of time and work in a fast-paced environment. 
 
Education, Certifications and Work Experience Requirements:
  • Applicants must be 16 years of age or older. High School applicants accepted.
  • While no formal education or work experience is required, previous guest service experience at a bakery, restaurant or retail store is a plus.  
 
Work Availability: 
Must have the flexibility to work various shifts, including early mornings, evenings, weekends and holidays, based on changing business demands.

The Guest Services Representative sweetens up the place,
setting the mood and making a stop in the bakery an event worth posting about. You’ll
get to play party planner by helping guests order the right cake for their celebrations
and making sure their orders go off without a hitch. You’ll make everyone feel
welcome, and you’ll create an environment of generosity, happiness, and joy in your
community.

But it gets even better:

We close early so you can enjoy your evenings.
We’re keeping it casual. T-shirts and sneakers are where it’s at!
You don’t have to be 18 to work here, so students can join us.
This job is fun. It’s literally a piece of cake!
This is a great place to make new friends!
You’ll get trained. Not only on crafting cake, but on growing your career.
We love to celebrate and bring joy to the community!

At Nothing Bundt Cakes, we make the best cakes around! We are looking for a fast-working, punctual, friendly person with a positive attitude and an excellent work ethic to join our team as a Guest Service Representative. 
   
No experience necessary, but candidates should possess the ability to maintain a positive attitude and work quickly/efficiently in a fast-paced setting. We pride ourselves on maintaining a fun working environment.
  • GREAT STORE HOURS
    • Monday-Friday: 10am - 7pm
    • Saturday: 9am - 5pm
    • Closed Sundays and all major holidays!
  • FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE - We take care of our people and try to accommodate schedule requests.
  • FUN WORK ATMOSPHERE - It's not life or death - it's just cake, and we want our team to enjoy what they do!
This position is for a morning opener (10 AM weekdays).
Part-time and seasonal positions available.
Training begins November 28th with anticipated store opening December 3rd.

Enjoy three days off while keeping full time hours and benefits! offers very flexible scheduling with the ability to work up to 40 hours in a 4 day workweek! Weekend availability consisting of a Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays are a must. You don't have to work all of em', but we need your expertise during our busiest shifts.

  • Flexible scheduling.
  • Full time and part time shifts are available.
  • Free Shift Meal and Discounts on HuHot food items when you're not working.

Inspiration from Italy. Hospitality from the heart.

Full Job Description 

Make life more delicious! Exciting opportunity to join a growing local company with multiple locations! Fiorella's Cucina is seeking Bartenders for our Newton location. We are looking for someone with a passion for hospitality, a desire to learn and a great personality! The Bartender is one of the most important roles in our company. The Bartenders responsibilities include strong menu knowledge, food and beverage sales, cash handling, and ensuring a positive guest experience. Fiorella's is a family owned and operated Italian restaurant dedicated to superior quality food and beverages, legendary customer service, and treating our team members like family. We are proud of our ability to create regulars and of our fun, upbeat, family atmosphere. We believe our team is our most valuable resource and success depends upon a culture of creating and retaining a staff capable of delivering an exceptional experience, one meal at a time, every time.

Must be flexible and available to work a minimum of three shifts per week.

Inspiration from Italy. Hospitality from the heart. www.fiorellascucina.com

Summary of Position:  

The Hospitality Associate will be displaying our core values when communicating with the guests and the team. The Hospitality Associate will ensure the guests have an exceptional dining and take-out experience with Fiorella’s. This role is responsible for managing the POS, answering telephone, and taking orders. 

 

Activities and Responsibilities:


I will… 

  • Greet guest-personally: learn to recognize regulars and greet all guests with a warm and welcoming smile. Make sure to acknowledge every guest when they walk through the door.
  • Embody Fiorella’s core values through constant and never ending learning from the Fiorella’s team. 
  • Validate guest experience by ensuring our guests enjoyed their meals, securing their return.
  • Build my legacy at Fiorella’s by making special bonds and memories with our guests and team. 
  • Communicate efficiently internally and externally to create an exceptional experience for our guests. 
  • Answer the phone as soon as possible (unless with another guest) in a professional manner in  accordance with our phone procedure and restaurant standards. Remember a guest can hear you smile through the phone!
  • Adhere to order accuracy standards with every interaction I have with a guest.
  • Follow our standards regarding any catering order requests.
  • Complete all daily and weekly side work for each shift.
  • Accurately and efficiently bag the orders for our guests following our bagging procedure. 
  • Manage the cash drawer, POS system, and process payments.
  • Maintain a general working knowledge of restaurant information such as: restaurant hours, along with the addresses & phone numbers for the other Fiorella’s locations.
  • Display teamwork with all positions to adhere to all restaurant standards.
  • Report all equipment problems and maintenance issues to the manager on duty.
  • Make sure the front of the house is clean and orderly at all times.
  • Inform guests of new products,  promotions, and specials.
  • Enhance the dining experience for our guests by being able to make appropriate suggestions/recommendations with my menu knowledge of each dish (ingredients and preparation). 
  • Be responsible for supporting and executing Fiorella’s marketing promotions and birthday club.  
  • Maintain communication among the team in regards to any relevant information or concerns.
  • Communicate health and/or safety concerns/violations immediately to the supervisor.
  • Provide partial table service to on-site guests.
  • Adhere to the restaurant guidelines of food, safety, and sanitation provided by the health department.
  • Understand all policies, procedures, and service standards of the restaurant.
  • Attend all informational and team building meetings to continue expanding my knowledge and skills. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

Preparation, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Possess communication skills to create a positive interactions experience with guests
  • Having basic writing, reading, math skills, as well as computer and phone proficiency
  • Previous restaurant experience is not required 

Working Conditions/Physical Demands

  • Be able to bend, reach, stoop and frequently lift to 50 pounds

  • Maintain good personal hygiene
  • Be able to effectively communicate with guests and staff with consciousness non-verbal language and cues
  • Maintain good organizational and time management skills to ensure a quick response to kitchen and guests’ needs
  • Have a positive teamwork and motivational skills

  • Maintain a general working knowledge of restaurant information such as: restaurant hours, along with the addresses & phone numbers for the other Fiorella’s locations.
  • Display teamwork with all positions to adhere to all restaurant standards.
  • Report all equipment problems and maintenance issues to the manager on duty.
  • Make sure the front of the house is clean and orderly at all times.
  • Inform guests of new products,  promotions, and specials.
  • Enhance the dining experience for our guests by being able to make appropriate suggestions/recommendations with my menu knowledge of each dish (ingredients and preparation). 
  • Be responsible for supporting and executing Fiorella’s marketing promotions and birthday club.  
  • Maintain communication among the team in regards to any relevant information or concerns.
  • Communicate health and/or safety concerns/violations immediately to the supervisor.
  • Provide partial table service to on-site guests.
  • Adhere to the restaurant guidelines of food, safety, and sanitation provided by the health department.
  • Understand all policies, procedures, and service standards of the restaurant.
  • Attend all informational and team building meetings to continue expanding my knowledge and skills. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

  • Possess communication skills to create a positive interactions experience with guests
  • Having basic writing, reading, math skills, as well as computer and phone proficiency
  • Previous restaurant experience is not required

  • Be able to bend, reach, stoop and frequently lift to 50 pounds

  • Maintain good personal hygiene
  • Be able to effectively communicate with guests and staff with consciousness non-verbal language and cues
  • Maintain good organizational and time management skills to ensure a quick response to kitchen and guests’ needs

Full Job Description 

Make life more delicious! Exciting opportunity to join a growing local company with multiple locations! Fiorella's Cucina is seeking Bartenders for our Newton location. We are looking for someone with a passion for hospitality, a desire to learn and a great personality! The Bartender is one of the most important roles in our company. The Bartenders responsibilities include strong menu knowledge, food and beverage sales, cash handling, and ensuring a positive guest experience. Fiorella's is a family owned and operated Italian restaurant dedicated to superior quality food and beverages, legendary customer service, and treating our team members like family. We are proud of our ability to create regulars and of our fun, upbeat, family atmosphere. We believe our team is our most valuable resource and success depends upon a culture of creating and retaining a staff capable of delivering an exceptional experience, one meal at a time, every time.

Must be flexible and available to work a minimum of three shifts per week.

Summary of Position:  

The Hospitality Associate will be displaying our core values when communicating with the guests and the team. The Hospitality Associate will ensure the guests have an exceptional dining and take-out experience with Fiorella’s. This role is responsible for managing the POS, answering telephone, and taking orders. 

 

Activities and Responsibilities:


I will… 

  • Greet guest-personally: learn to recognize regulars and greet all guests with a warm and welcoming smile. Make sure to acknowledge every guest when they walk through the door.
  • Embody Fiorella’s core values through constant and never ending learning from the Fiorella’s team. 
  • Validate guest experience by ensuring our guests enjoyed their meals, securing their return.
  • Build my legacy at Fiorella’s by making special bonds and memories with our guests and team. 
  • Communicate efficiently internally and externally to create an exceptional experience for our guests. 
  • Answer the phone as soon as possible (unless with another guest) in a professional manner in  accordance with our phone procedure and restaurant standards. Remember a guest can hear you smile through the phone!
  • Adhere to order accuracy standards with every interaction I have with a guest.
  • Follow our standards regarding any catering order requests.
  • Complete all daily and weekly side work for each shift.
  • Accurately and efficiently bag the orders for our guests following our bagging procedure. 
  • Manage the cash drawer, POS system, and process payments.
  • Maintain a general working knowledge of restaurant information such as: restaurant hours, along with the addresses & phone numbers for the other Fiorella’s locations.
  • Display teamwork with all positions to adhere to all restaurant standards.
  • Report all equipment problems and maintenance issues to the manager on duty.
  • Make sure the front of the house is clean and orderly at all times.
  • Inform guests of new products,  promotions, and specials.
  • Enhance the dining experience for our guests by being able to make appropriate suggestions/recommendations with my menu knowledge of each dish (ingredients and preparation). 
  • Be responsible for supporting and executing Fiorella’s marketing promotions and birthday club.  
  • Maintain communication among the team in regards to any relevant information or concerns.
  • Communicate health and/or safety concerns/violations immediately to the supervisor.
  • Provide partial table service to on-site guests.
  • Adhere to the restaurant guidelines of food, safety, and sanitation provided by the health department.
  • Understand all policies, procedures, and service standards of the restaurant.
  • Attend all informational and team building meetings to continue expanding my knowledge and skills. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

Preparation, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Possess communication skills to create a positive interactions experience with guests
  • Having basic writing, reading, math skills, as well as computer and phone proficiency
  • Previous restaurant experience is not required 

Working Conditions/Physical Demands

  • Be able to bend, reach, stoop and frequently lift to 50 pounds

  • Maintain good personal hygiene
  • Be able to effectively communicate with guests and staff with consciousness non-verbal language and cues
  • Maintain good organizational and time management skills to ensure a quick response to kitchen and guests’ needs
  • Have a positive teamwork and motivational skills

At Perkins Restaurant & Bakery our employees are part of the Perkins extended family and the families we serve. And you'll be responsible for making special days memorable and everyday meals something extraordinary.  At Perkins where we've experienced years of success through ensuring 100% guest satisfaction on every visit. If you want to work and grow with a company who has a proven track record of success, has an unmatched commitment to their employees and employees the best in the industry, you are in the right place! We respect one another for our talent, creativity and individual differences. We bring our greatest individual strengths to achieve success as a team. If career growth is what you are looking for- we got that too.
 
SUMMARY OF POSITION
Provides friendly and efficient service to guests according to company policies, procedures, programs and performance standards. Performs all duties to maximize guest satisfaction and quality of work environment as directed by Manager on Duty.  Controls the flow of business in the dining room so guests feel welcome and comfortable. Check out Guests at the register. Provides genuine hospitality to each guest ensuring their dining experience is highly satisfactory.
 
POSITION ACTIVITIES AND TASKS
  • Host Activities and Guest Interaction
  • Reports to work well-groomed, in clean and proper uniform and at all times practices good personal hygiene.
  • Opens the door as guests enter and leave the building.
  • Uses greeting, seating and waiting list procedures. Seats guests in a friendly and timely manner in person or on telephone.
  • Anticipates, identifies and corrects system breakdowns to achieve maximum guest satisfaction.
  • Completes wait sheets 
  • Greet and Seat – Welcome new Guests as they arrive and show them to their seats.  Make a friendly first impression. Describe features, soup of the day, etc.
  • Take Cash – Check out Guests at the register.  Ask Guests, “How was your meal and service?” Thank Guests and invite them to return.
  • Hospitality – Move through the dining room regularly and ensure Guests have all items needed.  Be attentive – make Guests feel special.
  • Sell Bakery – Offer specific suggestions for take-out bakery items.  Efficiently package to-go orders.
  • Clean – Ensure that the cashier area, bakery cases and displays, lobby area, entryway and Guest restrooms and dining room stay clean throughout the shift.
  • Ensures menus are clean
 
Assist Crew Members
  • Processes To-Go orders 
  • Maintains guests’ needs throughout their dining experience by assisting servers with pre bussing procedures
  • Sweeps floor around tables to assist servers were needed
  • Performs side work during shift downtime including but not limited to; rolling silverware, restocking cleaning works stations and bussing tables, etc.
  • Provides assistance to all servers and bus persons in order to execute service standards.
  • Ensures 100% guest satisfaction on every visit.
  • Communicates with Manager on Duty and coworkers regarding product/service deficiencies, equipment, safety problems. Etc.
  • Keeps General Manager and Manager on Duty informed of problems and/or issues and proposes alternative solutions for consideration.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Extensive standing and walking for up to 8 hours
  • Must be able to see at a distance (20) feet, at close range (12 inches), distinguish between shapes and utilize peripheral vision to avoid hazards.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly
  • Exposure to heat, steam, smoke, cold
  • Must have time management skills
  • Must be able to read, write and perform addition/subtraction calculations
  • Must be able to control and utilize fingers to write, slice chop and operate equipment.
  • Must be able to work irregular hours under heavy pressure/stress during busy times
  • Bending, reaching, walking
  • Exposure to dish and cleaning chemicals

 
SUPERVISION RECEIVED:
Receives direction and training from Manager on duty as to the specific procedures and assignments.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIRED:
Basic skills such as sanitation, safety, and customer service can be taught through in house training.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
None
 
Disclaimer
This position description in not intended, and should not be construed to be, an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with job. It is intended, however, to be an accurate reflection of those principle job elements essential for making decisions related to job performance, employee development and compensation. As such, the incumbent may perform other duties and responsibilities as required.

  • Reports to work well-groomed, in clean and proper uniform and at all times practices good personal hygiene.
  • Opens the door as guests enter and leave the building.
  • Uses greeting, seating and waiting list procedures. Seats guests in a friendly and timely manner in person or on telephone.
  • Anticipates, identifies and corrects system breakdowns to achieve maximum guest satisfaction.
  • Completes wait sheets 
  • Greet and Seat – Welcome new Guests as they arrive and show them to their seats.  Make a friendly first impression. Describe features, soup of the day, etc.
  • Take Cash – Check out Guests at the register.  Ask Guests, “How was your meal and service?” Thank Guests and invite them to return.
  • Hospitality – Move through the dining room regularly and ensure Guests have all items needed.  Be attentive – make Guests feel special.
  • Sell Bakery – Offer specific suggestions for take-out bakery items.  Efficiently package to-go orders.
  • Clean – Ensure that the cashier area, bakery cases and displays, lobby area, entryway and Guest restrooms and dining room stay clean throughout the shift.
  • Ensures menus are clean
 
Assist Crew Members
  • Processes To-Go orders 
  • Maintains guests’ needs throughout their dining experience by assisting servers with pre bussing procedures
  • Sweeps floor around tables to assist servers were needed
  • Performs side work during shift downtime including but not limited to; rolling silverware, restocking cleaning works stations and bussing tables, etc.
  • Provides assistance to all servers and bus persons in order to execute service standards.
  • Ensures 100% guest satisfaction on every visit.
  • Communicates with Manager on Duty and coworkers regarding product/service deficiencies, equipment, safety problems. Etc.
  • Keeps General Manager and Manager on Duty informed of problems and/or issues and proposes alternative solutions for consideration.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Extensive standing and walking for up to 8 hours
  • Must be able to see at a distance (20) feet, at close range (12 inches), distinguish between shapes and utilize peripheral vision to avoid hazards.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly
  • Exposure to heat, steam, smoke, cold
  • Reaching heights of approximately 6 feet and depts. of 2 ½ - 3 feet.
  • Must have high level of mobility/flexibility in space provided
  • Must have time management skills
  • Must be able to read, write and perform addition/subtraction calculations
  • Must be able to control and utilize fingers to write, slice chop and operate equipment.
  • Must be able to fit through openings 30” wide
  • Must be able to work irregular hours under heavy pressure/stress during busy times
  • Bending, reaching, walking
  • Carrying trays of food products weighing about 50 pounds for distances up to 30 feet
  • Lifting up to 50 pounds
  • Exposure to dish and cleaning chemicals

 
SUPERVISION RECEIVED:
Receives direction and training from Manager on duty as to the specific procedures and assignments.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIRED:
Basic skills such as sanitation, safety, and customer service can be taught through in house training.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
None
 
Disclaimer
This position description in not intended, and should not be construed to be, an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with job. It is intended, however, to be an accurate reflection of those principle job elements essential for making decisions related to job performance, employee development and compensation. As such, the incumbent may perform other duties and responsibilities as required.

SUMMARY OF POSITION

  • Opens the door as guests enter and leave the building.
  • Uses greeting, seating and waiting list procedures. Seats guests in a friendly and timely manner in person or on telephone.
  • Anticipates, identifies and corrects system breakdowns to achieve maximum guest satisfaction.
  • Completes wait sheets 
  • Greet and Seat – Welcome new Guests as they arrive and show them to their seats.  Make a friendly first impression. Describe features, soup of the day, etc.
  • Take Cash – Check out Guests at the register.  Ask Guests, “How was your meal and service?” Thank Guests and invite them to return.
  • Hospitality – Move through the dining room regularly and ensure Guests have all items needed.  Be attentive – make Guests feel special.
  • Sell Bakery – Offer specific suggestions for take-out bakery items.  Efficiently package to-go orders.
  • Clean – Ensure that the cashier area, bakery cases and displays, lobby area, entryway and Guest restrooms and dining room stay clean throughout the shift.
  • Ensures menus are clean
 
Assist Crew Members
  • Processes To-Go orders 
  • Maintains guests’ needs throughout their dining experience by assisting servers with pre bussing procedures
  • Sweeps floor around tables to assist servers were needed
  • Performs side work during shift downtime including but not limited to; rolling silverware, restocking cleaning works stations and bussing tables, etc.
  • Provides assistance to all servers and bus persons in order to execute service standards.
  • Ensures 100% guest satisfaction on every visit.
  • Communicates with Manager on Duty and coworkers regarding product/service deficiencies, equipment, safety problems. Etc.
  • Keeps General Manager and Manager on Duty informed of problems and/or issues and proposes alternative solutions for consideration.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Extensive standing and walking for up to 8 hours
  • Must be able to see at a distance (20) feet, at close range (12 inches), distinguish between shapes and utilize peripheral vision to avoid hazards.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly
  • Exposure to heat, steam, smoke, cold
  • Reaching heights of approximately 6 feet and depts. of 2 ½ - 3 feet.
  • Must have high level of mobility/flexibility in space provided
  • Must have time management skills
  • Must be able to read, write and perform addition/subtraction calculations
  • Must be able to control and utilize fingers to write, slice chop and operate equipment.
  • Must be able to fit through openings 30” wide
  • Must be able to work irregular hours under heavy pressure/stress during busy times
  • Bending, reaching, walking
  • Carrying trays of food products weighing about 50 pounds for distances up to 30 feet
  • Lifting up to 50 pounds
  • Exposure to dish and cleaning chemicals

 
SUPERVISION RECEIVED:
Receives direction and training from Manager on duty as to the specific procedures and assignments.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIRED:
Basic skills such as sanitation, safety, and customer service can be taught through in house training.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
None

  • Opens the door as guests enter and leave the building.
  • Uses greeting, seating and waiting list procedures. Seats guests in a friendly and timely manner in person or on telephone.
  • Anticipates, identifies and corrects system breakdowns to achieve maximum guest satisfaction.
  • Completes wait sheets 
  • Greet and Seat – Welcome new Guests as they arrive and show them to their seats.  Make a friendly first impression. Describe features, soup of the day, etc.
  • Take Cash – Check out Guests at the register.  Ask Guests, “How was your meal and service?” Thank Guests and invite them to return.
  • Hospitality – Move through the dining room regularly and ensure Guests have all items needed.  Be attentive – make Guests feel special.
  • Sell Bakery – Offer specific suggestions for take-out bakery items.  Efficiently package to-go orders.
  • Clean – Ensure that the cashier area, bakery cases and displays, lobby area, entryway and Guest restrooms and dining room stay clean throughout the shift.
  • Ensures menus are clean
 
Assist Crew Members
  • Processes To-Go orders 
  • Maintains guests’ needs throughout their dining experience by assisting servers with pre bussing procedures
  • Sweeps floor around tables to assist servers were needed
  • Performs side work during shift downtime including but not limited to; rolling silverware, restocking cleaning works stations and bussing tables, etc.
  • Provides assistance to all servers and bus persons in order to execute service standards.
  • Ensures 100% guest satisfaction on every visit.
  • Communicates with Manager on Duty and coworkers regarding product/service deficiencies, equipment, safety problems. Etc.
  • Keeps General Manager and Manager on Duty informed of problems and/or issues and proposes alternative solutions for consideration.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Extensive standing and walking for up to 8 hours
  • Must be able to see at a distance (20) feet, at close range (12 inches), distinguish between shapes and utilize peripheral vision to avoid hazards.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly
  • Exposure to heat, steam, smoke, cold
  • Reaching heights of approximately 6 feet and depts. of 2 ½ - 3 feet.
  • Must have high level of mobility/flexibility in space provided
  • Must have time management skills
  • Must be able to read, write and perform addition/subtraction calculations
  • Must be able to control and utilize fingers to write, slice chop and operate equipment.
  • Must be able to fit through openings 30” wide
  • Must be able to work irregular hours under heavy pressure/stress during busy times
  • Bending, reaching, walking
  • Carrying trays of food products weighing about 50 pounds for distances up to 30 feet
  • Lifting up to 50 pounds
  • Exposure to dish and cleaning chemicals

 
SUPERVISION RECEIVED:
Receives direction and training from Manager on duty as to the specific procedures and assignments.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIRED:
Basic skills such as sanitation, safety, and customer service can be taught through in house training.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
None

  • Uses greeting, seating and waiting list procedures. Seats guests in a friendly and timely manner in person or on telephone.
  • Anticipates, identifies and corrects system breakdowns to achieve maximum guest satisfaction.
  • Completes wait sheets 
  • Greet and Seat – Welcome new Guests as they arrive and show them to their seats.  Make a friendly first impression. Describe features, soup of the day, etc.
  • Take Cash – Check out Guests at the register.  Ask Guests, “How was your meal and service?” Thank Guests and invite them to return.
  • Hospitality – Move through the dining room regularly and ensure Guests have all items needed.  Be attentive – make Guests feel special.
  • Sell Bakery – Offer specific suggestions for take-out bakery items.  Efficiently package to-go orders.
  • Clean – Ensure that the cashier area, bakery cases and displays, lobby area, entryway and Guest restrooms and dining room stay clean throughout the shift.
  • Ensures menus are clean
 
Assist Crew Members
  • Processes To-Go orders 
  • Maintains guests’ needs throughout their dining experience by assisting servers with pre bussing procedures
  • Sweeps floor around tables to assist servers were needed
  • Performs side work during shift downtime including but not limited to; rolling silverware, restocking cleaning works stations and bussing tables, etc.
  • Provides assistance to all servers and bus persons in order to execute service standards.
  • Ensures 100% guest satisfaction on every visit.
  • Communicates with Manager on Duty and coworkers regarding product/service deficiencies, equipment, safety problems. Etc.
  • Keeps General Manager and Manager on Duty informed of problems and/or issues and proposes alternative solutions for consideration.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Extensive standing and walking for up to 8 hours
  • Must be able to see at a distance (20) feet, at close range (12 inches), distinguish between shapes and utilize peripheral vision to avoid hazards.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly
  • Exposure to heat, steam, smoke, cold
  • Reaching heights of approximately 6 feet and depts. of 2 ½ - 3 feet.
  • Must have high level of mobility/flexibility in space provided
  • Must have time management skills
  • Must be able to read, write and perform addition/subtraction calculations
  • Must be able to control and utilize fingers to write, slice chop and operate equipment.
  • Must be able to fit through openings 30” wide
  • Must be able to work irregular hours under heavy pressure/stress during busy times
  • Bending, reaching, walking
  • Carrying trays of food products weighing about 50 pounds for distances up to 30 feet
  • Lifting up to 50 pounds
  • Exposure to dish and cleaning chemicals

 
SUPERVISION RECEIVED:
Receives direction and training from Manager on duty as to the specific procedures and assignments.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIRED:
Basic skills such as sanitation, safety, and customer service can be taught through in house training.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
None

Company Overview

Shells is a locally-owned restaurant group that serves fresh seafood in a fun, no frills environment! We offer competitive wages; we can arrange flexible schedules for our team members still in school and we are growing and training/developing from within our ranks for those who are looking for a career in the industry! 
 
Benefits/Perks 
  • Mondays off
  • Health Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Employee Meals
  • Flexible Schedules

Responsibilities
 
Before Shift

  • Stocks Carryout supplies and forms.
  • Count Cash Drawer to insure it is proper amount.

During Shift

  • Opens door & greets Guests entering the restaurant with a friendly “Big Hello”.
  • Gauges an accurate waiting period when restaurant becomes full
  • Answers incoming phone calls.
  • Takes Carry-out orders from call-in and walk-in guests.
  • Prepares carryout orders for pickup including condiments..
  • Takes payment for carryout orders and enters in POS
  • Makes Guests comfortable in waiting area, serving a beverage if necessary.
  • When time permits, assists Servers with miscellaneous requests such as picking up plates from tables
  • or running condiments to a table.
  • Tracks Carryout Ticket times to keep quote time accurate.
  • Organizes the carryout station and maintains stocking levels. 
  • Thanks Guests at they are leaving to ensure and promote return visits.
  • When time permits, can assist servers with rolling of silverware.

Closing

  • Cashes out and balances cash drawer with a manager.
  • Sweeps floor in carryout area.

Minimum Requirements:

  • High School or GED equivalent preferred.
  • Previous Hostess experience a plus.
  • Previous experience in retail, hospitality, or customer service industry preferred.

And you'll be responsible for making special days memorable and everyday meals something extraordinary.  At Perkins where we've experienced years of success through ensuring 100% guest satisfaction on every visit. If you want to work and grow with a company who has a proven track record of success, has an unmatched commitment to their employees and employees the best in the industry, you are in the right place! We respect one another for our talent, creativity and individual differences. We bring our greatest individual strengths to achieve success as a team. If career growth is what you are looking for- we got that too!
 
SUMMARY OF POSITION
Provides friendly and efficient service to guests according to company policies, procedures, programs and performance standards. Performs all duties to maximize guest satisfaction and quality of work environment as directed by Manager on Duty.  Controls the flow of business in the dining room so guests feel welcome and comfortable. Check out Guests at the register. Provides genuine hospitality to each guest ensuring their dining experience is highly satisfactory.
 
POSITION ACTIVITIES AND TASKS
  • Host Activities and Guest Interaction
  • Reports to work well-groomed, in clean and proper uniform and at all times practices good personal hygiene.
  • Opens the door as guests enter and leave the building.
  • Uses greeting, seating and waiting list procedures. Seats guests in a friendly and timely manner in person or on telephone.
  • Anticipates, identifies and corrects system breakdowns to achieve maximum guest satisfaction.
  • Completes wait sheets 
  • Greet and Seat – Welcome new Guests as they arrive and show them to their seats.  Make a friendly first impression. Describe features, soup of the day, etc.
  • Take Cash – Check out Guests at the register.  Ask Guests, “How was your meal and service?” Thank Guests and invite them to return.
  • Hospitality – Move through the dining room regularly and ensure Guests have all items needed.  Be attentive – make Guests feel special.
  • Sell Bakery – Offer specific suggestions for take-out bakery items.  Efficiently package to-go orders.
  • Clean – Ensure that the cashier area, bakery cases and displays, lobby area, entryway and Guest restrooms and dining room stay clean throughout the shift.
  • Ensures menus are clean
 
Assist Crew Members
  • Processes To-Go orders 
  • Maintains guests’ needs throughout their dining experience by assisting servers with pre bussing procedures
  • Sweeps floor around tables to assist servers were needed
  • Performs side work during shift downtime including but not limited to; rolling silverware, restocking cleaning works stations and bussing tables, etc.
  • Provides assistance to all servers and bus persons in order to execute service standards.
  • Ensures 100% guest satisfaction on every visit.
  • Communicates with Manager on Duty and coworkers regarding product/service deficiencies, equipment, safety problems. Etc.
  • Keeps General Manager and Manager on Duty informed of problems and/or issues and proposes alternative solutions for consideration.
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Extensive standing and walking for up to 8 hours
  • Must be able to see at a distance (20) feet, at close range (12 inches), distinguish between shapes and utilize peripheral vision to avoid hazards.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly
  • Exposure to heat, steam, smoke, cold
  • Reaching heights of approximately 6 feet and depts. of 2 ½ - 3 feet.
  • Must have high level of mobility/flexibility in space provided
  • Must have time management skills
  • Must be able to read, write and perform addition/subtraction calculations
  • Must be able to control and utilize fingers to write, slice chop and operate equipment.
  • Must be able to fit through openings 30” wide
  • Must be able to work irregular hours under heavy pressure/stress during busy times
  • Bending, reaching, walking
  • Carrying trays of food products weighing about 50 pounds for distances up to 30 feet
  • Lifting up to 50 pounds
  • Exposure to dish and cleaning chemicals

 
SUPERVISION RECEIVED:
Receives direction and training from Manager on duty as to the specific procedures and assignments.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIRED:
Basic skills such as sanitation, safety, and customer service can be taught through in house training.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
None
 
Disclaimer
This position description in not intended, and should not be construed to be, an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with job. It is intended, however, to be an accurate reflection of those principle job elements essential for making decisions related to job performance, employee development and compensation. As such, the incumbent may perform other duties and responsibilities as required.

Job Summary:
Assigns stations to servers, greets and seats guests, evenly distributing business among servers.  Notifies servers of price changes.  Handles guest complaints.  Relays message to servers and bussers.  Receives payment and issues proper change and receipts.  Closes out cash register and prepares shift report.
 
Responsibilities:
-Assigns stations to servers and bussers.  Checks to see that stations are sufficiently supplied,  
  and that guests are properly taken care of.
-Greet guests as they enter dining area and seat them accordingly.
-Maintains a close working relationship with servers to encourage teamwork among the staff.
-Assist as a server or busser as needed.
-Receives check and payments from servers in the form of cash, check, house charge or credit 
  card, and follows established procedures for posting and depositing revenues.
-Adheres to all Health Department rules and regulations.
-Certified in Serving Alcohol with Care.
-Adhere to ZMC Hotels and Holiday Inn Standards.
-Must be responsible for security of guests, fellow employees and hotel assets.
-Must be CPR certified, MSDS trained, and completed AWAIR program
-Must perform any other required duties as requested by the General Manager to aid in better   
  operation of the hotel, restaurant, lounge, and service to the guests.
- All duties must be carried out in a safe manner.
- Be flexible and adaptable to the changes that will occur to your job
- Employee must treat everyone with dignity and respect.
-Keep confidential the business functions of the company including, but not limited to, financial   status, customer/guest information, employee issues, etc.
 
Qualifications:
  • Highly organized.
  • Must be able to work the majority of the shift in a standing position, constantly moving, and able to lift 30 pounds.
  • Strong Guest Service Skills
  • Must have attention to detail and be customer service oriented.
  • Ability to communicate satisfactorily with guests, management, and co-workers.
 
Benefits/Perks:
  • Medical, Dental, Paid time off, 401(k) for full-time employees
  • All employees get discounts on hotel’s outside of their hotel they work in
  • Opportunities for bonuses
  • $250 referral bonus for you and a referred associate
  • Daily Pay: access to your already earned wages before payday *Hourly Employees Only*
